setChatAdministratorCustomTitle.desc: Use this method to set a custom title for an administrator in a supergroup promoted by the bot. Returns True on success.

params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)
params.name: chat_id

params.description: Unique identifier of the target user
params.name: user_id

params.description: New custom title for the administrator; 0-16 characters, emoji are not allowed
params.name: custom_title

setChatDescription.desc: Use this method to change the description of a group, a supergroup or a channel. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate administrator rights. Returns True on success.

params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)
params.name: chat_id

params.description: New chat description, 0-255 characters
params.name: description

setChatMenuButton.desc: Use this method to change the bot's menu button in a private chat, or the default menu button. Returns True on success.

params.description: Unique identifier for the target private chat. If not specified, default bot's menu button will be changed
params.name: chat_id

params.description: A JSON-serialized object for the bot's new menu button. Defaults to MenuButtonDefault
params.name: menu_button

setChatPermissions.desc: Use this method to set default chat permissions for all members. The bot must be an administrator in the group or a supergroup for this to work and must have the can_restrict_members administrator rights. Returns True on success.

params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)
params.name: chat_id

params.description: A JSON-serialized object for new default chat permissions
params.name: permissions

params.description: Pass True if chat permissions are set independently. Otherwise, the can_send_other_messages and can_add_web_page_previews permissions will imply the can_send_messages, can_send_audios, can_send_documents, can_send_photos, can_send_videos, can_send_video_notes, and can_send_voice_notes permissions; the can_send_polls permission will imply the can_send_messages permission.
params.name: use_independent_chat_permissions

setChatPhoto.desc: Use this method to set a new profile photo for the chat. Photos can't be changed for private chats. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate administrator rights. Returns True on success.

params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)
params.name: chat_id

params.description: New chat photo, uploaded using multipart/form-data
params.name: photo

setChatStickerSet.desc: Use this method to set a new group sticker set for a supergroup. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate administrator rights. Use the field can_set_sticker_set optionally returned in getChat requests to check if the bot can use this method. Returns True on success.

params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)
params.name: chat_id

params.description: Name of the sticker set to be set as the group sticker set
params.name: sticker_set_name

setChatTitle.desc: Use this method to change the title of a chat. Titles can't be changed for private chats. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate administrator rights. Returns True on success.

params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)
params.name: chat_id

params.description: New chat title, 1-128 characters
params.name: title

setCustomEmojiStickerSetThumbnail.desc: Use this method to set the thumbnail of a custom emoji sticker set. Returns True on success.

params.description: Sticker set name
params.name: name

params.description: Custom emoji identifier of a sticker from the sticker set; pass an empty string to drop the thumbnail and use the first sticker as the thumbnail.
params.name: custom_emoji_id

setGameScore.desc: Use this method to set the score of the specified user in a game message. On success, if the message is not an inline message, the Message is returned, otherwise True is returned. Returns an error, if the new score is not greater than the user's current score in the chat and force is False.

params.description: User identifier
params.name: user_id

params.description: New score, must be non-negative
params.name: score

params.description: Pass True if the high score is allowed to decrease. This can be useful when fixing mistakes or banning cheaters
params.name: force

params.description: Pass True if the game message should not be automatically edited to include the current scoreboard
params.name: disable_edit_message

params.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat
params.name: chat_id

params.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the sent message
params.name: message_id

params.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message
params.name: inline_message_id

setMessageReaction.desc: Use this method to change the chosen reactions on a message. Service messages can't be reacted to. Automatically forwarded messages from a channel to its discussion group have the same available reactions as messages in the channel. Returns True on success.

params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)
params.name: chat_id

params.description: Identifier of the target message. If the message belongs to a media group, the reaction is set to the first non-deleted message in the group instead.
params.name: message_id

params.description: A JSON-serialized list of reaction types to set on the message. Currently, as non-premium users, bots can set up to one reaction per message. A custom emoji reaction can be used if it is either already present on the message or explicitly allowed by chat administrators.
params.name: reaction

params.description: Pass True to set the reaction with a big animation
params.name: is_big

setMyCommands.desc: Use this method to change the list of the bot's commands. See this manual for more details about bot commands. Returns True on success.

params.description: A JSON-serialized list of bot commands to be set as the list of the bot's commands. At most 100 commands can be specified.
params.name: commands

params.description: A JSON-serialized object, describing scope of users for which the commands are relevant. Defaults to BotCommandScopeDefault.
params.name: scope

params.description: A two-letter ISO 639-1 language code. If empty, commands will be applied to all users from the given scope, for whose language there are no dedicated commands
params.name: language_code

setMyDefaultAdministratorRights.desc: Use this method to change the default administrator rights requested by the bot when it's added as an administrator to groups or channels. These rights will be suggested to users, but they are free to modify the list before adding the bot. Returns True on success.

params.description: A JSON-serialized object describing new default administrator rights. If not specified, the default administrator rights will be cleared.
params.name: rights

params.description: Pass True to change the default administrator rights of the bot in channels. Otherwise, the default administrator rights of the bot for groups and supergroups will be changed.
params.name: for_channels

setMyDescription.desc: Use this method to change the bot's description, which is shown in the chat with the bot if the chat is empty. Returns True on success.

params.description: New bot description; 0-512 characters. Pass an empty string to remove the dedicated description for the given language.
params.name: description

params.description: A two-letter ISO 639-1 language code. If empty, the description will be applied to all users for whose language there is no dedicated description.
params.name: language_code

setMyName.desc: Use this method to change the bot's name. Returns True on success.

params.description: New bot name; 0-64 characters. Pass an empty string to remove the dedicated name for the given language.
params.name: name

params.description: A two-letter ISO 639-1 language code. If empty, the name will be shown to all users for whose language there is no dedicated name.
params.name: language_code

setMyShortDescription.desc: Use this method to change the bot's short description, which is shown on the bot's profile page and is sent together with the link when users share the bot. Returns True on success.

params.description: New short description for the bot; 0-120 characters. Pass an empty string to remove the dedicated short description for the given language.
params.name: short_description

params.description: A two-letter ISO 639-1 language code. If empty, the short description will be applied to all users for whose language there is no dedicated short description.
params.name: language_code

setPassportDataErrors.desc: Informs a user that some of the Telegram Passport elements they provided contains errors. The user will not be able to re-submit their Passport to you until the errors are fixed (the contents of the field for which you returned the error must change). Returns True on success. Use this if the data submitted by the user doesn't satisfy the standards your service requires for any reason. For example, if a birthday date seems invalid, a submitted document is blurry, a scan shows evidence of tampering, etc. Supply some details in the error message to make sure the user knows how to correct the issues.

params.description: User identifier
params.name: user_id

params.description: A JSON-serialized array describing the errors
params.name: errors

setStickerEmojiList.desc: Use this method to change the list of emoji assigned to a regular or custom emoji sticker. The sticker must belong to a sticker set created by the bot. Returns True on success.

params.description: File identifier of the sticker
params.name: sticker

params.description: A JSON-serialized list of 1-20 emoji associated with the sticker
params.name: emoji_list

setStickerKeywords.desc: Use this method to change search keywords assigned to a regular or custom emoji sticker. The sticker must belong to a sticker set created by the bot. Returns True on success.

params.description: File identifier of the sticker
params.name: sticker

params.description: A JSON-serialized list of 0-20 search keywords for the sticker with total length of up to 64 characters
params.name: keywords

setStickerMaskPosition.desc: Use this method to change the mask position of a mask sticker. The sticker must belong to a sticker set that was created by the bot. Returns True on success.

params.description: File identifier of the sticker
params.name: sticker

params.description: A JSON-serialized object with the position where the mask should be placed on faces. Omit the parameter to remove the mask position.
params.name: mask_position

setStickerPositionInSet.desc: Use this method to move a sticker in a set created by the bot to a specific position. Returns True on success.

params.description: File identifier of the sticker
params.name: sticker

params.description: New sticker position in the set, zero-based
params.name: position

setStickerSetThumbnail.desc: Use this method to set the thumbnail of a regular or mask sticker set. The format of the thumbnail file must match the format of the stickers in the set. Returns True on success.

params.description: Sticker set name
params.name: name

params.description: User identifier of the sticker set owner
params.name: user_id

params.description: A .WEBP or .PNG image with the thumbnail, must be up to 128 kilobytes in size and have a width and height of exactly 100px, or a .TGS animation with a thumbnail up to 32 kilobytes in size (see https://core.telegram.org/stickers#animated-sticker-requirements for animated sticker technical requirements), or a WEBM video with the thumbnail up to 32 kilobytes in size; see https://core.telegram.org/stickers#video-sticker-requirements for video sticker technical requirements. Pass a file_id as a String to send a file that already exists on the Telegram servers, pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or upload a new one using multipart/form-data. More information on Sending Files ». Animated and video sticker set thumbnails can't be uploaded via HTTP URL. If omitted, then the thumbnail is dropped and the first sticker is used as the thumbnail.
params.name: thumbnail

params.description: Format of the thumbnail, must be one of “static” for a .WEBP or .PNG image, “animated” for a .TGS animation, or “video” for a WEBM video
params.name: format

setStickerSetTitle.desc: Use this method to set the title of a created sticker set. Returns True on success.

params.description: Sticker set name
params.name: name

params.description: Sticker set title, 1-64 characters
params.name: title

setWebhook.desc: Use this method to specify a URL and receive incoming updates via an outgoing webhook. Whenever there is an update for the bot, we will send an HTTPS POST request to the specified URL, containing a JSON-serialized Update. In case of an unsuccessful request, we will give up after a reasonable amount of attempts. Returns True on success. If you'd like to make sure that the webhook was set by you, you can specify secret data in the parameter secret_token. If specified, the request will contain a header “X-Telegram-Bot-Api-Secret-Token” with the secret token as content.

params.description: HTTPS URL to send updates to. Use an empty string to remove webhook integration
params.name: url

params.description: Upload your public key certificate so that the root certificate in use can be checked. See our self-signed guide for details.
params.name: certificate

params.description: The fixed IP address which will be used to send webhook requests instead of the IP address resolved through DNS
params.name: ip_address

params.description: The maximum allowed number of simultaneous HTTPS connections to the webhook for update delivery, 1-100. Defaults to 40. Use lower values to limit the load on your bot's server, and higher values to increase your bot's throughput.
params.name: max_connections

params.description: A JSON-serialized list of the update types you want your bot to receive. For example, specify ["message", "edited_channel_post", "callback_query"] to only receive updates of these types. See Update for a complete list of available update types. Specify an empty list to receive all update types except chat_member, message_reaction, and message_reaction_count (default). If not specified, the previous setting will be used. Please note that this parameter doesn't affect updates created before the call to the setWebhook, so unwanted updates may be received for a short period of time.
params.name: allowed_updates

params.description: Pass True to drop all pending updates
params.name: drop_pending_updates

params.description: A secret token to be sent in a header “X-Telegram-Bot-Api-Secret-Token” in every webhook request, 1-256 characters. Only characters A-Z, a-z, 0-9, _ and - are allowed. The header is useful to ensure that the request comes from a webhook set by you.
params.name: secret_token

stopMessageLiveLocation.desc: Use this method to stop updating a live location message before live_period expires. On success, if the message is not an inline message, the edited Message is returned, otherwise True is returned.

params.description: Unique identifier of the business connection on behalf of which the message to be edited was sent
params.name: business_connection_id

params.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)
params.name: chat_id

params.description: Required if inline_message_id is not specified. Identifier of the message with live location to stop
params.name: message_id

params.description: Required if chat_id and message_id are not specified. Identifier of the inline message
params.name: inline_message_id

params.description: A JSON-serialized object for a new inline keyboard.
params.name: reply_markup

stopPoll.desc: Use this method to stop a poll which was sent by the bot. On success, the stopped Poll is returned.

params.description: Unique identifier of the business connection on behalf of which the message to be edited was sent
params.name: business_connection_id

params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)
params.name: chat_id

params.description: Identifier of the original message with the poll
params.name: message_id

params.description: A JSON-serialized object for a new message inline keyboard.
params.name: reply_markup

unbanChatMember.desc: Use this method to unban a previously banned user in a supergroup or channel. The user will not return to the group or channel automatically, but will be able to join via link, etc. The bot must be an administrator for this to work. By default, this method guarantees that after the call the user is not a member of the chat, but will be able to join it. So if the user is a member of the chat they will also be removed from the chat. If you don't want this, use the parameter only_if_banned. Returns True on success.

params.description: Unique identifier for the target group or username of the target supergroup or channel (in the format @channelusername)
params.name: chat_id

params.description: Unique identifier of the target user
params.name: user_id

params.description: Do nothing if the user is not banned
params.name: only_if_banned

unbanChatSenderChat.desc: Use this method to unban a previously banned channel chat in a supergroup or channel. The bot must be an administrator for this to work and must have the appropriate administrator rights. Returns True on success.

params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)
params.name: chat_id

params.description: Unique identifier of the target sender chat
params.name: sender_chat_id

unhideGeneralForumTopic.desc: Use this method to unhide the 'General' topic in a forum supergroup chat. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the can_manage_topics administrator rights. Returns True on success.

params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)
params.name: chat_id

unpinAllChatMessages.desc: Use this method to clear the list of pinned messages in a chat. If the chat is not a private chat, the bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the 'can_pin_messages' administrator right in a supergroup or 'can_edit_messages' administrator right in a channel. Returns True on success.

params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)
params.name: chat_id

unpinAllForumTopicMessages.desc: Use this method to clear the list of pinned messages in a forum topic. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the can_pin_messages administrator right in the supergroup. Returns True on success.

params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)
params.name: chat_id

params.description: Unique identifier for the target message thread of the forum topic
params.name: message_thread_id

unpinAllGeneralForumTopicMessages.desc: Use this method to clear the list of pinned messages in a General forum topic. The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the can_pin_messages administrator right in the supergroup. Returns True on success.

params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)
params.name: chat_id

unpinChatMessage.desc: Use this method to remove a message from the list of pinned messages in a chat. If the chat is not a private chat, the bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the 'can_pin_messages' administrator right in a supergroup or 'can_edit_messages' administrator right in a channel. Returns True on success.

params.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target channel (in the format @channelusername)
params.name: chat_id

params.description: Identifier of a message to unpin. If not specified, the most recent pinned message (by sending date) will be unpinned.
params.name: message_id

uploadStickerFile.desc: Use this method to upload a file with a sticker for later use in the createNewStickerSet, addStickerToSet, or replaceStickerInSet methods (the file can be used multiple times). Returns the uploaded File on success.

params.description: User identifier of sticker file owner
params.name: user_id

params.description: A file with the sticker in .WEBP, .PNG, .TGS, or .WEBM format. See https://core.telegram.org/stickers for technical requirements. More information on Sending Files »
params.name: sticker

params.description: Format of the sticker, must be one of “static”, “animated”, “video”
params.name: sticker_format

Animation.desc: This object represents an animation file (GIF or H.264/MPEG-4 AVC video without sound).

fields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file
fields.name: file_id

fields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.
fields.name: file_unique_id

fields.description: Video width as defined by the sender
fields.name: width

fields.description: Video height as defined by the sender
fields.name: height

fields.description: Duration of the video in seconds as defined by the sender
fields.name: duration

fields.description: Optional. Animation thumbnail as defined by the sender
fields.name: thumbnail

fields.description: Optional. Original animation filename as defined by the sender
fields.name: file_name

fields.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by the sender
fields.name: mime_type

fields.description: Optional. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.
fields.name: file_size

Audio.desc: This object represents an audio file to be treated as music by the Telegram clients.

fields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file
fields.name: file_id

fields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.
fields.name: file_unique_id

fields.description: Duration of the audio in seconds as defined by the sender
fields.name: duration

fields.description: Optional. Performer of the audio as defined by the sender or by audio tags
fields.name: performer

fields.description: Optional. Title of the audio as defined by the sender or by audio tags
fields.name: title

fields.description: Optional. Original filename as defined by the sender
fields.name: file_name

fields.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by the sender
fields.name: mime_type

fields.description: Optional. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.
fields.name: file_size

fields.description: Optional. Thumbnail of the album cover to which the music file belongs
fields.name: thumbnail

BackgroundFill.desc: This object describes the way a background is filled based on the selected colors. Currently, it can be one of BackgroundFillSolid; BackgroundFillGradient; BackgroundFillFreeformGradient

BackgroundFillFreeformGradient.desc: The background is a freeform gradient that rotates after every message in the chat.

fields.description: Type of the background fill, always “freeform_gradient”
fields.name: type

fields.description: A list of the 3 or 4 base colors that are used to generate the freeform gradient in the RGB24 format
fields.name: colors

BackgroundFillGradient.desc: The background is a gradient fill.

fields.description: Type of the background fill, always “gradient”
fields.name: type

fields.description: Top color of the gradient in the RGB24 format
fields.name: top_color

fields.description: Bottom color of the gradient in the RGB24 format
fields.name: bottom_color

fields.description: Clockwise rotation angle of the background fill in degrees; 0-359
fields.name: rotation_angle

BackgroundFillSolid.desc: The background is filled using the selected color.

fields.description: Type of the background fill, always “solid”
fields.name: type

fields.description: The color of the background fill in the RGB24 format
fields.name: color

BackgroundType.desc: This object describes the type of a background. Currently, it can be one of BackgroundTypeFill; BackgroundTypeWallpaper; BackgroundTypePattern; BackgroundTypeChatTheme

fields.name: __alias__
fields.type: BackgroundTypeFill or BackgroundTypeWallpaper or BackgroundTypePattern or BackgroundTypeChatTheme

BackgroundTypeChatTheme.desc: The background is taken directly from a built-in chat theme.

fields.description: Type of the background, always “chat_theme”
fields.name: type

fields.description: Name of the chat theme, which is usually an emoji
fields.name: theme_name

BackgroundTypeFill.desc: The background is automatically filled based on the selected colors.

fields.description: Type of the background, always “fill”
fields.name: type

fields.description: The background fill
fields.name: fill

fields.description: Dimming of the background in dark themes, as a percentage; 0-100
fields.name: dark_theme_dimming

BackgroundTypePattern.desc: The background is a PNG or TGV (gzipped subset of SVG with MIME type “application/x-tgwallpattern”) pattern to be combined with the background fill chosen by the user.

fields.description: Type of the background, always “pattern”
fields.name: type

fields.description: Document with the pattern
fields.name: document

fields.description: The background fill that is combined with the pattern
fields.name: fill

fields.description: Intensity of the pattern when it is shown above the filled background; 0-100
fields.name: intensity

fields.description: Optional. True, if the background fill must be applied only to the pattern itself. All other pixels are black in this case. For dark themes only
fields.name: is_inverted

fields.description: Optional. True, if the background moves slightly when the device is tilted
fields.name: is_moving

BackgroundTypeWallpaper.desc: The background is a wallpaper in the JPEG format.

fields.description: Type of the background, always “wallpaper”
fields.name: type

fields.description: Document with the wallpaper
fields.name: document

fields.description: Dimming of the background in dark themes, as a percentage; 0-100
fields.name: dark_theme_dimming

fields.description: Optional. True, if the wallpaper is downscaled to fit in a 450x450 square and then box-blurred with radius 12
fields.name: is_blurred

fields.description: Optional. True, if the background moves slightly when the device is tilted
fields.name: is_moving

Birthdate.desc: Describes the birthdate of a user.

fields.description: Day of the user's birth; 1-31
fields.name: day

fields.description: Month of the user's birth; 1-12
fields.name: month

fields.description: Optional. Year of the user's birth
fields.name: year

BotCommand.desc: This object represents a bot command.

fields.description: Text of the command; 1-32 characters. Can contain only lowercase English letters, digits and underscores.
fields.name: command

fields.description: Description of the command; 1-256 characters.
fields.name: description

BotCommandScope.desc: This object represents the scope to which bot commands are applied. Currently, the following 7 scopes are supported: BotCommandScopeDefault; BotCommandScopeAllPrivateChats; BotCommandScopeAllGroupChats; BotCommandScopeAllChatAdministrators; BotCommandScopeChat; BotCommandScopeChatAdministrators; BotCommandScopeChatMember

fields.name: __alias__
fields.type: BotCommandScopeDefault or BotCommandScopeAllPrivateChats or BotCommandScopeAllGroupChats or BotCommandScopeAllChatAdministrators or BotCommandScopeChat or BotCommandScopeChatAdministrators or BotCommandScopeChatMember

BotCommandScopeAllChatAdministrators.desc: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering all group and supergroup chat administrators.

fields.description: Scope type, must be all_chat_administrators
fields.name: type

BotCommandScopeAllGroupChats.desc: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering all group and supergroup chats.

fields.description: Scope type, must be all_group_chats
fields.name: type

BotCommandScopeAllPrivateChats.desc: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering all private chats.

fields.description: Scope type, must be all_private_chats
fields.name: type

BotCommandScopeChat.desc: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering a specific chat.

fields.description: Scope type, must be chat
fields.name: type

fields.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)
fields.name: chat_id

BotCommandScopeChatAdministrators.desc: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering all administrators of a specific group or supergroup chat.

fields.description: Scope type, must be chat_administrators
fields.name: type

fields.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)
fields.name: chat_id

BotCommandScopeChatMember.desc: Represents the scope of bot commands, covering a specific member of a group or supergroup chat.

fields.description: Scope type, must be chat_member
fields.name: type

fields.description: Unique identifier for the target chat or username of the target supergroup (in the format @supergroupusername)
fields.name: chat_id

fields.description: Unique identifier of the target user
fields.name: user_id

BotCommandScopeDefault.desc: Represents the default scope of bot commands. Default commands are used if no commands with a narrower scope are specified for the user.

fields.description: Scope type, must be default
fields.name: type

BotDescription.desc: This object represents the bot's description.

fields.description: The bot's description
fields.name: description

BotName.desc: This object represents the bot's name.

fields.description: The bot's name
fields.name: name

BotShortDescription.desc: This object represents the bot's short description.

fields.description: The bot's short description
fields.name: short_description

BusinessConnection.desc: Describes the connection of the bot with a business account.

fields.description: Unique identifier of the business connection
fields.name: id

fields.description: Business account user that created the business connection
fields.name: user

fields.description: Identifier of a private chat with the user who created the business connection. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.
fields.name: user_chat_id

fields.description: Date the connection was established in Unix time
fields.name: date

fields.description: True, if the bot can act on behalf of the business account in chats that were active in the last 24 hours
fields.name: can_reply

fields.description: True, if the connection is active
fields.name: is_enabled

BusinessIntro.desc: Contains information about the start page settings of a Telegram Business account.

fields.description: Optional. Title text of the business intro
fields.name: title

fields.description: Optional. Message text of the business intro
fields.name: message

fields.description: Optional. Sticker of the business intro
fields.name: sticker

BusinessLocation.desc: Contains information about the location of a Telegram Business account.

fields.description: Address of the business
fields.name: address

fields.description: Optional. Location of the business
fields.name: location

BusinessMessagesDeleted.desc: This object is received when messages are deleted from a connected business account.

fields.description: Unique identifier of the business connection
fields.name: business_connection_id

fields.description: Information about a chat in the business account. The bot may not have access to the chat or the corresponding user.
fields.name: chat

fields.description: The list of identifiers of deleted messages in the chat of the business account
fields.name: message_ids

BusinessOpeningHours.desc: Describes the opening hours of a business.

fields.description: Unique name of the time zone for which the opening hours are defined
fields.name: time_zone_name

fields.description: List of time intervals describing business opening hours
fields.name: opening_hours

BusinessOpeningHoursInterval.desc: Describes an interval of time during which a business is open.

fields.description: The minute's sequence number in a week, starting on Monday, marking the start of the time interval during which the business is open; 0 - 7 * 24 * 60
fields.name: opening_minute

fields.description: The minute's sequence number in a week, starting on Monday, marking the end of the time interval during which the business is open; 0 - 8 * 24 * 60
fields.name: closing_minute

CallbackGame.desc: A placeholder, currently holds no information. Use [BotFather](https://t.me/botfather) to set up your game.

CallbackQuery.desc: This object represents an incoming callback query from a callback button in an inline keyboard. If the button that originated the query was attached to a message sent by the bot, the field message will be present. If the button was attached to a message sent via the bot (in inline mode), the field inline_message_id will be present. Exactly one of the fields data or game_short_name will be present.

fields.description: Unique identifier for this query
fields.name: id

fields.description: Sender
fields.name: from

fields.description: Optional. Message sent by the bot with the callback button that originated the query
fields.name: message

fields.description: Optional. Identifier of the message sent via the bot in inline mode, that originated the query.
fields.name: inline_message_id

fields.description: Global identifier, uniquely corresponding to the chat to which the message with the callback button was sent. Useful for high scores in games.
fields.name: chat_instance

fields.description: Optional. Data associated with the callback button. Be aware that the message originated the query can contain no callback buttons with this data.
fields.name: data

fields.description: Optional. Short name of a Game to be returned, serves as the unique identifier for the game
fields.name: game_short_name

fields.description: Unique identifier for this chat. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.
fields.name: id

fields.description: Type of the chat, can be either “private”, “group”, “supergroup” or “channel”
fields.name: type

fields.description: Optional. Title, for supergroups, channels and group chats
fields.name: title

fields.description: Optional. Username, for private chats, supergroups and channels if available
fields.name: username

fields.description: Optional. First name of the other party in a private chat
fields.name: first_name

fields.description: Optional. Last name of the other party in a private chat
fields.name: last_name

fields.description: Optional. True, if the supergroup chat is a forum (has topics enabled)
fields.name: is_forum

ChatAdministratorRights.desc: Represents the rights of an administrator in a chat.

fields.description: True, if the user's presence in the chat is hidden
fields.name: is_anonymous

fields.description: True, if the administrator can access the chat event log, get boost list, see hidden supergroup and channel members, report spam messages and ignore slow mode. Implied by any other administrator privilege.
fields.name: can_manage_chat

fields.description: True, if the administrator can delete messages of other users
fields.name: can_delete_messages

fields.description: True, if the administrator can manage video chats
fields.name: can_manage_video_chats

fields.description: True, if the administrator can restrict, ban or unban chat members, or access supergroup statistics
fields.name: can_restrict_members

fields.description: True, if the administrator can add new administrators with a subset of their own privileges or demote administrators that they have promoted, directly or indirectly (promoted by administrators that were appointed by the user)
fields.name: can_promote_members

fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings
fields.name: can_change_info

fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat
fields.name: can_invite_users

fields.description: True, if the administrator can post stories to the chat
fields.name: can_post_stories

fields.description: True, if the administrator can edit stories posted by other users, post stories to the chat page, pin chat stories, and access the chat's story archive
fields.name: can_edit_stories

fields.description: True, if the administrator can delete stories posted by other users
fields.name: can_delete_stories

fields.description: Optional. True, if the administrator can post messages in the channel, or access channel statistics; for channels only
fields.name: can_post_messages

fields.description: Optional. True, if the administrator can edit messages of other users and can pin messages; for channels only
fields.name: can_edit_messages

fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to pin messages; for groups and supergroups only
fields.name: can_pin_messages

fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to create, rename, close, and reopen forum topics; for supergroups only
fields.name: can_manage_topics

ChatBackground.desc: This object represents a chat background.

fields.description: Type of the background
fields.name: type

ChatBoost.desc: This object contains information about a chat boost.

fields.description: Unique identifier of the boost
fields.name: boost_id

fields.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the chat was boosted
fields.name: add_date

fields.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the boost will automatically expire, unless the booster's Telegram Premium subscription is prolonged
fields.name: expiration_date

fields.description: Source of the added boost
fields.name: source

ChatBoostAdded.desc: This object represents a service message about a user boosting a chat.

fields.description: Number of boosts added by the user
fields.name: boost_count

ChatBoostRemoved.desc: This object represents a boost removed from a chat.

fields.description: Chat which was boosted
fields.name: chat

fields.description: Unique identifier of the boost
fields.name: boost_id

fields.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the boost was removed
fields.name: remove_date

fields.description: Source of the removed boost
fields.name: source

ChatBoostSource.desc: This object describes the source of a chat boost. It can be one of ChatBoostSourcePremium; ChatBoostSourceGiftCode; ChatBoostSourceGiveaway

ChatBoostSourceGiftCode.desc: The boost was obtained by the creation of Telegram Premium gift codes to boost a chat. Each such code boosts the chat 4 times for the duration of the corresponding Telegram Premium subscription.

fields.description: Source of the boost, always “gift_code”
fields.name: source

fields.description: User for which the gift code was created
fields.name: user

ChatBoostSourceGiveaway.desc: The boost was obtained by the creation of a Telegram Premium giveaway. This boosts the chat 4 times for the duration of the corresponding Telegram Premium subscription.

fields.description: Source of the boost, always “giveaway”
fields.name: source

fields.description: Identifier of a message in the chat with the giveaway; the message could have been deleted already. May be 0 if the message isn't sent yet.
fields.name: giveaway_message_id

fields.description: Optional. User that won the prize in the giveaway if any
fields.name: user

fields.description: Optional. True, if the giveaway was completed, but there was no user to win the prize
fields.name: is_unclaimed

ChatBoostSourcePremium.desc: The boost was obtained by subscribing to Telegram Premium or by gifting a Telegram Premium subscription to another user.

fields.description: Source of the boost, always “premium”
fields.name: source

fields.description: User that boosted the chat
fields.name: user

ChatBoostUpdated.desc: This object represents a boost added to a chat or changed.

fields.description: Chat which was boosted
fields.name: chat

fields.description: Information about the chat boost
fields.name: boost

ChatFullInfo.desc: This object contains full information about a chat.

fields.description: Unique identifier for this chat. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.
fields.name: id

fields.description: Type of the chat, can be either “private”, “group”, “supergroup” or “channel”
fields.name: type

fields.description: Optional. Title, for supergroups, channels and group chats
fields.name: title

fields.description: Optional. Username, for private chats, supergroups and channels if available
fields.name: username

fields.description: Optional. First name of the other party in a private chat
fields.name: first_name

fields.description: Optional. Last name of the other party in a private chat
fields.name: last_name

fields.description: Optional. True, if the supergroup chat is a forum (has topics enabled)
fields.name: is_forum

fields.description: Identifier of the accent color for the chat name and backgrounds of the chat photo, reply header, and link preview. See accent colors for more details.
fields.name: accent_color_id

fields.description: The maximum number of reactions that can be set on a message in the chat
fields.name: max_reaction_count

fields.description: Optional. Chat photo
fields.name: photo

fields.description: Optional. If non-empty, the list of all active chat usernames; for private chats, supergroups and channels
fields.name: active_usernames

fields.description: Optional. For private chats, the date of birth of the user
fields.name: birthdate

fields.description: Optional. For private chats with business accounts, the intro of the business
fields.name: business_intro

fields.description: Optional. For private chats with business accounts, the location of the business
fields.name: business_location

fields.description: Optional. For private chats with business accounts, the opening hours of the business
fields.name: business_opening_hours

fields.description: Optional. For private chats, the personal channel of the user
fields.name: personal_chat

fields.description: Optional. List of available reactions allowed in the chat. If omitted, then all emoji reactions are allowed.
fields.name: available_reactions

fields.description: Optional. Custom emoji identifier of the emoji chosen by the chat for the reply header and link preview background
fields.name: background_custom_emoji_id

fields.description: Optional. Identifier of the accent color for the chat's profile background. See profile accent colors for more details.
fields.name: profile_accent_color_id

fields.description: Optional. Custom emoji identifier of the emoji chosen by the chat for its profile background
fields.name: profile_background_custom_emoji_id

fields.description: Optional. Custom emoji identifier of the emoji status of the chat or the other party in a private chat
fields.name: emoji_status_custom_emoji_id

fields.description: Optional. Expiration date of the emoji status of the chat or the other party in a private chat, in Unix time, if any
fields.name: emoji_status_expiration_date

fields.description: Optional. Bio of the other party in a private chat
fields.name: bio

fields.description: Optional. True, if privacy settings of the other party in the private chat allows to use tg://user?id=<user_id> links only in chats with the user
fields.name: has_private_forwards

fields.description: Optional. True, if the privacy settings of the other party restrict sending voice and video note messages in the private chat
fields.name: has_restricted_voice_and_video_messages

fields.description: Optional. True, if users need to join the supergroup before they can send messages
fields.name: join_to_send_messages

fields.description: Optional. True, if all users directly joining the supergroup without using an invite link need to be approved by supergroup administrators
fields.name: join_by_request

fields.description: Optional. Description, for groups, supergroups and channel chats
fields.name: description

fields.description: Optional. Primary invite link, for groups, supergroups and channel chats
fields.name: invite_link

fields.description: Optional. The most recent pinned message (by sending date)
fields.name: pinned_message

fields.description: Optional. Default chat member permissions, for groups and supergroups
fields.name: permissions

fields.description: Optional. True, if paid media messages can be sent or forwarded to the channel chat. The field is available only for channel chats.
fields.name: can_send_paid_media

fields.description: Optional. For supergroups, the minimum allowed delay between consecutive messages sent by each unprivileged user; in seconds
fields.name: slow_mode_delay

fields.description: Optional. For supergroups, the minimum number of boosts that a non-administrator user needs to add in order to ignore slow mode and chat permissions
fields.name: unrestrict_boost_count

fields.description: Optional. The time after which all messages sent to the chat will be automatically deleted; in seconds
fields.name: message_auto_delete_time

fields.description: Optional. True, if aggressive anti-spam checks are enabled in the supergroup. The field is only available to chat administrators.
fields.name: has_aggressive_anti_spam_enabled

fields.description: Optional. True, if non-administrators can only get the list of bots and administrators in the chat
fields.name: has_hidden_members

fields.description: Optional. True, if messages from the chat can't be forwarded to other chats
fields.name: has_protected_content

fields.description: Optional. True, if new chat members will have access to old messages; available only to chat administrators
fields.name: has_visible_history

fields.description: Optional. For supergroups, name of the group sticker set
fields.name: sticker_set_name

fields.description: Optional. True, if the bot can change the group sticker set
fields.name: can_set_sticker_set

fields.description: Optional. For supergroups, the name of the group's custom emoji sticker set. Custom emoji from this set can be used by all users and bots in the group.
fields.name: custom_emoji_sticker_set_name

fields.description: Optional. Unique identifier for the linked chat, i.e. the discussion group identifier for a channel and vice versa; for supergroups and channel chats. This identifier may be greater than 32 bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it is smaller than 52 bits, so a signed 64 bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.
fields.name: linked_chat_id

fields.description: Optional. For supergroups, the location to which the supergroup is connected
fields.name: location

ChatInviteLink.desc: Represents an invite link for a chat.

fields.description: The invite link. If the link was created by another chat administrator, then the second part of the link will be replaced with “…”.
fields.name: invite_link

fields.description: Creator of the link
fields.name: creator

fields.description: True, if users joining the chat via the link need to be approved by chat administrators
fields.name: creates_join_request

fields.description: True, if the link is primary
fields.name: is_primary

fields.description: True, if the link is revoked
fields.name: is_revoked

fields.description: Optional. Invite link name
fields.name: name

fields.description: Optional. Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the link will expire or has been expired
fields.name: expire_date

fields.description: Optional. The maximum number of users that can be members of the chat simultaneously after joining the chat via this invite link; 1-99999
fields.name: member_limit

fields.description: Optional. Number of pending join requests created using this link
fields.name: pending_join_request_count

ChatJoinRequest.desc: Represents a join request sent to a chat.

fields.description: Chat to which the request was sent
fields.name: chat

fields.description: User that sent the join request
fields.name: from

fields.description: Identifier of a private chat with the user who sent the join request. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier. The bot can use this identifier for 5 minutes to send messages until the join request is processed, assuming no other administrator contacted the user.
fields.name: user_chat_id

fields.description: Date the request was sent in Unix time
fields.name: date

fields.description: Optional. Bio of the user.
fields.name: bio

fields.description: Optional. Chat invite link that was used by the user to send the join request
fields.name: invite_link

ChatLocation.desc: Represents a location to which a chat is connected.

fields.description: The location to which the supergroup is connected. Can't be a live location.
fields.name: location

fields.description: Location address; 1-64 characters, as defined by the chat owner
fields.name: address

ChatMember.desc: This object contains information about one member of a chat. Currently, the following 6 types of chat members are supported: ChatMemberOwner; ChatMemberAdministrator; ChatMemberMember; ChatMemberRestricted; ChatMemberLeft; ChatMemberBanned

fields.name: __alias__
fields.type: ChatMemberOwner or ChatMemberAdministrator or ChatMemberMember or ChatMemberRestricted or ChatMemberLeft or ChatMemberBanned

ChatMemberAdministrator.desc: Represents a chat member that has some additional privileges.

fields.description: The member's status in the chat, always “administrator”
fields.name: status

fields.description: Information about the user
fields.name: user

fields.description: True, if the bot is allowed to edit administrator privileges of that user
fields.name: can_be_edited

fields.description: True, if the user's presence in the chat is hidden
fields.name: is_anonymous

fields.description: True, if the administrator can access the chat event log, get boost list, see hidden supergroup and channel members, report spam messages and ignore slow mode. Implied by any other administrator privilege.
fields.name: can_manage_chat

fields.description: True, if the administrator can delete messages of other users
fields.name: can_delete_messages

fields.description: True, if the administrator can manage video chats
fields.name: can_manage_video_chats

fields.description: True, if the administrator can restrict, ban or unban chat members, or access supergroup statistics
fields.name: can_restrict_members

fields.description: True, if the administrator can add new administrators with a subset of their own privileges or demote administrators that they have promoted, directly or indirectly (promoted by administrators that were appointed by the user)
fields.name: can_promote_members

fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings
fields.name: can_change_info

fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat
fields.name: can_invite_users

fields.description: True, if the administrator can post stories to the chat
fields.name: can_post_stories

fields.description: True, if the administrator can edit stories posted by other users, post stories to the chat page, pin chat stories, and access the chat's story archive
fields.name: can_edit_stories

fields.description: True, if the administrator can delete stories posted by other users
fields.name: can_delete_stories

fields.description: Optional. True, if the administrator can post messages in the channel, or access channel statistics; for channels only
fields.name: can_post_messages

fields.description: Optional. True, if the administrator can edit messages of other users and can pin messages; for channels only
fields.name: can_edit_messages

fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to pin messages; for groups and supergroups only
fields.name: can_pin_messages

fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to create, rename, close, and reopen forum topics; for supergroups only
fields.name: can_manage_topics

fields.description: Optional. Custom title for this user
fields.name: custom_title

ChatMemberBanned.desc: Represents a chat member that was banned in the chat and can't return to the chat or view chat messages.

fields.description: The member's status in the chat, always “kicked”
fields.name: status

fields.description: Information about the user
fields.name: user

fields.description: Date when restrictions will be lifted for this user; Unix time. If 0, then the user is banned forever
fields.name: until_date

ChatMemberLeft.desc: Represents a chat member that isn't currently a member of the chat, but may join it themselves.

fields.description: The member's status in the chat, always “left”
fields.name: status

fields.description: Information about the user
fields.name: user

ChatMemberMember.desc: Represents a chat member that has no additional privileges or restrictions.

fields.description: The member's status in the chat, always “member”
fields.name: status

fields.description: Information about the user
fields.name: user

ChatMemberOwner.desc: Represents a chat member that owns the chat and has all administrator privileges.

fields.description: The member's status in the chat, always “creator”
fields.name: status

fields.description: Information about the user
fields.name: user

fields.description: True, if the user's presence in the chat is hidden
fields.name: is_anonymous

fields.description: Optional. Custom title for this user
fields.name: custom_title

ChatMemberRestricted.desc: Represents a chat member that is under certain restrictions in the chat. Supergroups only.

fields.description: The member's status in the chat, always “restricted”
fields.name: status

fields.description: Information about the user
fields.name: user

fields.description: True, if the user is a member of the chat at the moment of the request

fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to send text messages, contacts, giveaways, giveaway winners, invoices, locations and venues

fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to send audios

fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to send documents

fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to send photos

fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to send videos

fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to send video notes

fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to send voice notes

fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to send polls

fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to send animations, games, stickers and use inline bots

fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to change the chat title, photo and other settings

fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to invite new users to the chat

fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to pin messages

fields.description: True, if the user is allowed to create forum topics

fields.description: Performer of the action, which resulted in the change

fields.description: Date the change was done in Unix time

fields.description: Previous information about the chat member

fields.description: Optional. Chat invite link, which was used by the user to join the chat; for joining by invite link events only.

fields.description: Optional. True, if the user joined the chat after sending a direct join request without using an invite link and being approved by an administrator

fields.description: Optional. True, if the user joined the chat via a chat folder invite link

ChatPermissions.desc: Describes actions that a non-administrator user is allowed to take in a chat.

fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send text messages, contacts, giveaways, giveaway winners, invoices, locations and venues

fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send audios

fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send photos

fields.description: Optional. True, if the user is allowed to send video notes
