ChatPhoto.desc: This object represents a chat photo.

fields.description: File identifier of small (160x160) chat photo. This file_id can be used only for photo download and only for as long as the photo is not changed.
fields.name: small_file_id

fields.description: Unique file identifier of small (160x160) chat photo, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.
fields.name: small_file_unique_id

fields.description: File identifier of big (640x640) chat photo. This file_id can be used only for photo download and only for as long as the photo is not changed.
fields.name: big_file_id

fields.description: Unique file identifier of big (640x640) chat photo, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.
fields.name: big_file_unique_id

ChatShared.desc: This object contains information about a chat that was shared with the bot using a KeyboardButtonRequestChat button.

fields.description: Identifier of the request
fields.name: request_id

fields.description: Identifier of the shared chat. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier. The bot may not have access to the chat and could be unable to use this identifier, unless the chat is already known to the bot by some other means.
fields.name: chat_id

fields.description: Optional. Title of the chat, if the title was requested by the bot.
fields.name: title

fields.description: Optional. Username of the chat, if the username was requested by the bot and available.
fields.name: username

fields.description: Optional. Available sizes of the chat photo, if the photo was requested by the bot
fields.name: photo

ChosenInlineResult.desc: Represents a result of an inline query that was chosen by the user and sent to their chat partner.

fields.description: The unique identifier for the result that was chosen
fields.name: result_id

fields.description: The user that chose the result
fields.name: from

fields.description: Optional. Sender location, only for bots that require user location
fields.name: location

fields.description: Optional. Identifier of the sent inline message. Available only if there is an inline keyboard attached to the message. Will be also received in callback queries and can be used to edit the message.
fields.name: inline_message_id

fields.description: The query that was used to obtain the result
fields.name: query

Contact.desc: This object represents a phone contact.

fields.description: Contact's phone number
fields.name: phone_number

fields.description: Contact's first name
fields.name: first_name

fields.description: Optional. Contact's last name
fields.name: last_name

fields.description: Optional. Contact's user identifier in Telegram. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.
fields.name: user_id

fields.description: Optional. Additional data about the contact in the form of a vCard
fields.name: vcard

Dice.desc: This object represents an animated emoji that displays a random value.

fields.description: Emoji on which the dice throw animation is based
fields.name: emoji

fields.description: Value of the dice, 1-6 for “🎲”, “🎯” and “🎳” base emoji, 1-5 for “🏀” and “⚽” base emoji, 1-64 for “🎰” base emoji
fields.name: value

Document.desc: This object represents a general file (as opposed to photos, voice messages and audio files).

fields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file
fields.name: file_id

fields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.
fields.name: file_unique_id

fields.description: Optional. Document thumbnail as defined by the sender
fields.name: thumbnail

fields.description: Optional. Original filename as defined by the sender
fields.name: file_name

fields.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by the sender
fields.name: mime_type

fields.description: Optional. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.
fields.name: file_size

EncryptedCredentials.desc: Describes data required for decrypting and authenticating EncryptedPassportElement. See the Telegram Passport Documentation for a complete description of the data decryption and authentication processes.

fields.description: Base64-encoded encrypted JSON-serialized data with unique user's payload, data hashes and secrets required for EncryptedPassportElement decryption and authentication
fields.name: data

fields.description: Base64-encoded data hash for data authentication
fields.name: hash

fields.description: Base64-encoded secret, encrypted with the bot's public RSA key, required for data decryption
fields.name: secret

EncryptedPassportElement.desc: Describes documents or other Telegram Passport elements shared with the bot by the user.

fields.description: Element type. One of “personal_details”, “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport”, “address”, “utility_bill”, “bank_statement”, “rental_agreement”, “passport_registration”, “temporary_registration”, “phone_number”, “email”.
fields.name: type

fields.description: Optional. Base64-encoded encrypted Telegram Passport element data provided by the user; available only for “personal_details”, “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport” and “address” types. Can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.
fields.name: data

fields.description: Optional. User's verified phone number; available only for “phone_number” type
fields.name: phone_number

fields.description: Optional. User's verified email address; available only for “email” type
fields.name: email

fields.description: Optional. Array of encrypted files with documents provided by the user; available only for “utility_bill”, “bank_statement”, “rental_agreement”, “passport_registration” and “temporary_registration” types. Files can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.
fields.name: files

fields.description: Optional. Encrypted file with the front side of the document, provided by the user; available only for “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card” and “internal_passport”. The file can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.
fields.name: front_side

fields.description: Optional. Encrypted file with the reverse side of the document, provided by the user; available only for “driver_license” and “identity_card”. The file can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.
fields.name: reverse_side

fields.description: Optional. Encrypted file with the selfie of the user holding a document, provided by the user; available if requested for “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card” and “internal_passport”. The file can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.
fields.name: selfie

fields.description: Optional. Array of encrypted files with translated versions of documents provided by the user; available if requested for “passport”, “driver_license”, “identity_card”, “internal_passport”, “utility_bill”, “bank_statement”, “rental_agreement”, “passport_registration” and “temporary_registration” types. Files can be decrypted and verified using the accompanying EncryptedCredentials.
fields.name: translation

fields.description: Base64-encoded element hash for using in PassportElementErrorUnspecified
fields.name: hash

ExternalReplyInfo.desc: This object contains information about a message that is being replied to, which may come from another chat or forum topic.

fields.description: Origin of the message replied to by the given message
fields.name: origin

fields.description: Optional. Chat the original message belongs to. Available only if the chat is a supergroup or a channel.
fields.name: chat

fields.description: Optional. Unique message identifier inside the original chat. Available only if the original chat is a supergroup or a channel.
fields.name: message_id

fields.description: Optional. Options used for link preview generation for the original message, if it is a text message
fields.name: link_preview_options

fields.description: Optional. Message is an animation, information about the animation
fields.name: animation

fields.description: Optional. Message is an audio file, information about the file
fields.name: audio

fields.description: Optional. Message is a general file, information about the file
fields.name: document

fields.description: Optional. Message contains paid media; information about the paid media
fields.name: paid_media

fields.description: Optional. Message is a photo, available sizes of the photo
fields.name: photo

fields.description: Optional. Message is a sticker, information about the sticker
fields.name: sticker

fields.description: Optional. Message is a forwarded story
fields.name: story

fields.description: Optional. Message is a video, information about the video
fields.name: video

fields.description: Optional. Message is a video note, information about the video message
fields.name: video_note

fields.description: Optional. Message is a voice message, information about the file
fields.name: voice

fields.description: Optional. True, if the message media is covered by a spoiler animation
fields.name: has_media_spoiler

fields.description: Optional. Message is a shared contact, information about the contact
fields.name: contact

fields.description: Optional. Message is a dice with random value
fields.name: dice

fields.description: Optional. Message is a game, information about the game. More about games »
fields.name: game

fields.description: Optional. Message is a scheduled giveaway, information about the giveaway
fields.name: giveaway

fields.description: Optional. A giveaway with public winners was completed
fields.name: giveaway_winners

fields.description: Optional. Message is an invoice for a payment, information about the invoice. More about payments »
fields.name: invoice

fields.description: Optional. Message is a shared location, information about the location
fields.name: location

fields.description: Optional. Message is a native poll, information about the poll
fields.name: poll

fields.description: Optional. Message is a venue, information about the venue
fields.name: venue

File.desc: This object represents a file ready to be downloaded. The file can be downloaded via the link https://api.telegram.org/file/bot<token>/<file_path>. It is guaranteed that the link will be valid for at least 1 hour. When the link expires, a new one can be requested by calling getFile. The maximum file size to download is 20 MB

fields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file
fields.name: file_id

fields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.
fields.name: file_unique_id

fields.description: Optional. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.
fields.name: file_size

fields.description: Optional. File path. Use https://api.telegram.org/file/bot<token>/<file_path> to get the file.
fields.name: file_path

ForceReply.desc: Upon receiving a message with this object, Telegram clients will display a reply interface to the user (act as if the user has selected the bot's message and tapped 'Reply'). This can be extremely useful if you want to create user-friendly step-by-step interfaces without having to sacrifice privacy mode. Not supported in channels and for messages sent on behalf of a Telegram Business account.

fields.description: Shows reply interface to the user, as if they manually selected the bot's message and tapped 'Reply'
fields.name: force_reply

fields.description: Optional. The placeholder to be shown in the input field when the reply is active; 1-64 characters
fields.name: input_field_placeholder

fields.description: Optional. Use this parameter if you want to force reply from specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply to a message in the same chat and forum topic, sender of the original message.
fields.name: selective

ForumTopic.desc: This object represents a forum topic.

fields.description: Unique identifier of the forum topic
fields.name: message_thread_id

fields.description: Name of the topic
fields.name: name

fields.description: Color of the topic icon in RGB format
fields.name: icon_color

fields.description: Optional. Unique identifier of the custom emoji shown as the topic icon
fields.name: icon_custom_emoji_id

ForumTopicClosed.desc: This object represents a service message about a forum topic closed in the chat. Currently holds no information.

ForumTopicCreated.desc: This object represents a service message about a new forum topic created in the chat.

fields.description: Name of the topic
fields.name: name

fields.description: Color of the topic icon in RGB format
fields.name: icon_color

fields.description: Optional. Unique identifier of the custom emoji shown as the topic icon
fields.name: icon_custom_emoji_id

ForumTopicEdited.desc: This object represents a service message about an edited forum topic.

fields.description: Optional. New name of the topic, if it was edited
fields.name: name

fields.description: Optional. New identifier of the custom emoji shown as the topic icon, if it was edited; an empty string if the icon was removed
fields.name: icon_custom_emoji_id

ForumTopicReopened.desc: This object represents a service message about a forum topic reopened in the chat. Currently holds no information.

Game.desc: This object represents a game. Use BotFather to create and edit games, their short names will act as unique identifiers.

fields.description: Title of the game
fields.name: title

fields.description: Description of the game
fields.name: description

fields.description: Photo that will be displayed in the game message in chats.
fields.name: photo

fields.description: Optional. Brief description of the game or high scores included in the game message. Can be automatically edited to include current high scores for the game when the bot calls setGameScore, or manually edited using editMessageText. 0-4096 characters.
fields.name: text

fields.description: Optional. Special entities that appear in text, such as usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc.
fields.name: text_entities

fields.description: Optional. Animation that will be displayed in the game message in chats. Upload via BotFather
fields.name: animation

GameHighScore.desc: This object represents one row of the high scores table for a game.

fields.description: Position in high score table for the game
fields.name: position

fields.description: User
fields.name: user

fields.description: Score
fields.name: score

GeneralForumTopicHidden.desc: This object represents a service message about General forum topic hidden in the chat. Currently holds no information.

GeneralForumTopicUnhidden.desc: This object represents a service message about General forum topic unhidden in the chat. Currently holds no information.

Giveaway.desc: This object represents a message about a scheduled giveaway.

fields.description: The list of chats which the user must join to participate in the giveaway
fields.name: chats

fields.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when winners of the giveaway will be selected
fields.name: winners_selection_date

fields.description: The number of users which are supposed to be selected as winners of the giveaway
fields.name: winner_count

fields.description: Optional. True, if only users who join the chats after the giveaway started should be eligible to win
fields.name: only_new_members

fields.description: Optional. True, if the list of giveaway winners will be visible to everyone
fields.name: has_public_winners

fields.description: Optional. Description of additional giveaway prize
fields.name: prize_description

fields.description: Optional. A list of two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country codes indicating the countries from which eligible users for the giveaway must come. If empty, then all users can participate in the giveaway. Users with a phone number that was bought on Fragment can always participate in giveaways.
fields.name: country_codes

fields.description: Optional. The number of months the Telegram Premium subscription won from the giveaway will be active for
fields.name: premium_subscription_month_count

GiveawayCompleted.desc: This object represents a service message about the completion of a giveaway without public winners.

fields.description: Number of winners in the giveaway
fields.name: winner_count

fields.description: Optional. Number of undistributed prizes
fields.name: unclaimed_prize_count

fields.description: Optional. Message with the giveaway that was completed, if it wasn't deleted
fields.name: giveaway_message

GiveawayCreated.desc: This object represents a service message about the creation of a scheduled giveaway. Currently holds no information.

GiveawayWinners.desc: This object represents a message about the completion of a giveaway with public winners.

fields.description: The chat that created the giveaway
fields.name: chat

fields.description: Identifier of the message with the giveaway in the chat
fields.name: giveaway_message_id

fields.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when winners of the giveaway were selected
fields.name: winners_selection_date

fields.description: Total number of winners in the giveaway
fields.name: winner_count

fields.description: List of up to 100 winners of the giveaway
fields.name: winners

fields.description: Optional. The number of other chats the user had to join in order to be eligible for the giveaway
fields.name: additional_chat_count

fields.description: Optional. The number of months the Telegram Premium subscription won from the giveaway will be active for
fields.name: premium_subscription_month_count

fields.description: Optional. Number of undistributed prizes
fields.name: unclaimed_prize_count

fields.description: Optional. True, if only users who had joined the chats after the giveaway started were eligible to win
fields.name: only_new_members

fields.description: Optional. True, if the giveaway was canceled because the payment for it was refunded
fields.name: was_refunded

fields.description: Optional. Description of additional giveaway prize
fields.name: prize_description

InaccessibleMessage.desc: This object describes a message that was deleted or is otherwise inaccessible to the bot.

fields.description: Chat the message belonged to
fields.name: chat

fields.description: Unique message identifier inside the chat
fields.name: message_id

fields.description: Always 0. The field can be used to differentiate regular and inaccessible messages.
fields.name: date

InlineKeyboardButton.desc: This object represents one button of an inline keyboard. Exactly one of the optional fields must be used to specify type of the button.

fields.description: Label text on the button
fields.name: text

fields.description: Optional. HTTP or tg:// URL to be opened when the button is pressed. Links tg://user?id=<user_id> can be used to mention a user by their identifier without using a username, if this is allowed by their privacy settings.
fields.name: url

fields.description: Optional. Data to be sent in a callback query to the bot when the button is pressed, 1-64 bytes
fields.name: callback_data

fields.description: Optional. Description of the Web App that will be launched when the user presses the button. The Web App will be able to send an arbitrary message on behalf of the user using the method answerWebAppQuery. Available only in private chats between a user and the bot. Not supported for messages sent on behalf of a Telegram Business account.
fields.name: web_app

fields.description: Optional. An HTTPS URL used to automatically authorize the user. Can be used as a replacement for the Telegram Login Widget.
fields.name: login_url

fields.description: Optional. If set, pressing the button will prompt the user to select one of their chats, open that chat and insert the bot's username and the specified inline query in the input field. May be empty, in which case just the bot's username will be inserted. Not supported for messages sent on behalf of a Telegram Business account.
fields.name: switch_inline_query

fields.description: Optional. If set, pressing the button will insert the bot's username and the specified inline query in the current chat's input field. May be empty, in which case only the bot's username will be inserted.   This offers a quick way for the user to open your bot in inline mode in the same chat - good for selecting something from multiple options. Not supported in channels and for messages sent on behalf of a Telegram Business account.
fields.name: switch_inline_query_current_chat

fields.description: Optional. If set, pressing the button will prompt the user to select one of their chats of the specified type, open that chat and insert the bot's username and the specified inline query in the input field. Not supported for messages sent on behalf of a Telegram Business account.
fields.name: switch_inline_query_chosen_chat

fields.description: Optional. Description of the game that will be launched when the user presses the button.   NOTE: This type of button must always be the first button in the first row.
fields.name: callback_game

fields.description: Optional. Specify True, to send a Pay button. Substrings “⭐” and “XTR” in the buttons's text will be replaced with a Telegram Star icon.   NOTE: This type of button must always be the first button in the first row and can only be used in invoice messages.
fields.name: pay

InlineKeyboardMarkup.desc: This object represents an inline keyboard that appears right next to the message it belongs to.

fields.description: Array of button rows, each represented by an Array of InlineKeyboardButton objects
fields.name: inline_keyboard

InlineQuery.desc: This object represents an incoming inline query. When the user sends an empty query, your bot could return some default or trending results.

fields.description: Unique identifier for this query
fields.name: id

fields.description: Sender
fields.name: from

fields.description: Text of the query (up to 256 characters)
fields.name: query

fields.description: Offset of the results to be returned, can be controlled by the bot
fields.name: offset

fields.description: Optional. Type of the chat from which the inline query was sent. Can be either “sender” for a private chat with the inline query sender, “private”, “group”, “supergroup”, or “channel”. The chat type should be always known for requests sent from official clients and most third-party clients, unless the request was sent from a secret chat
fields.name: chat_type

fields.description: Optional. Sender location, only for bots that request user location
fields.name: location

InlineQueryResult.desc: This object represents one result of an inline query. Telegram clients currently support results of the following 20 types: InlineQueryResultCachedAudio; InlineQueryResultCachedDocument; InlineQueryResultCachedGif; InlineQueryResultCachedMpeg4Gif; InlineQueryResultCachedPhoto; InlineQueryResultCachedSticker; InlineQueryResultCachedVideo; InlineQueryResultCachedVoice; InlineQueryResultArticle; InlineQueryResultAudio; InlineQueryResultContact; InlineQueryResultGame; InlineQueryResultDocument; InlineQueryResultGif; InlineQueryResultLocation; InlineQueryResultMpeg4Gif; InlineQueryResultPhoto; InlineQueryResultVenue; InlineQueryResultVideo; InlineQueryResultVoice

fields.name: __alias__
fields.type: InlineQueryResultCachedAudio or InlineQueryResultCachedDocument or InlineQueryResultCachedGif or InlineQueryResultCachedMpeg4Gif or InlineQueryResultCachedPhoto or InlineQueryResultCachedSticker or InlineQueryResultCachedVideo or InlineQueryResultCachedVoice or InlineQueryResultArticle or InlineQueryResultAudio or InlineQueryResultContact or InlineQueryResultGame or InlineQueryResultDocument or InlineQueryResultGif or InlineQueryResultLocation or InlineQueryResultMpeg4Gif or InlineQueryResultPhoto or InlineQueryResultVenue or InlineQueryResultVideo or InlineQueryResultVoice

InlineQueryResultArticle.desc: Represents a link to an article or web page.

fields.description: Type of the result, must be article
fields.name: type

fields.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 Bytes
fields.name: id

fields.description: Title of the result
fields.name: title

fields.description: Content of the message to be sent
fields.name: input_message_content

fields.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message
fields.name: reply_markup

fields.description: Optional. URL of the result
fields.name: url

fields.description: Optional. Pass True if you don't want the URL to be shown in the message
fields.name: hide_url

fields.description: Optional. Short description of the result
fields.name: description

fields.description: Optional. Url of the thumbnail for the result
fields.name: thumbnail_url

fields.description: Optional. Thumbnail width
fields.name: thumbnail_width

fields.description: Optional. Thumbnail height
fields.name: thumbnail_height

InlineQueryResultAudio.desc: Represents a link to an MP3 audio file. By default, this audio file will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the audio.

fields.description: Type of the result, must be audio
fields.name: type

fields.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes
fields.name: id

fields.description: A valid URL for the audio file
fields.name: audio_url

fields.description: Title
fields.name: title

fields.description: Optional. Caption, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing
fields.name: caption

fields.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the audio caption. See formatting options for more details.
fields.name: parse_mode

fields.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode
fields.name: caption_entities

fields.description: Optional. Performer
fields.name: performer

fields.description: Optional. Audio duration in seconds
fields.name: audio_duration

fields.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message
fields.name: reply_markup

fields.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the audio
fields.name: input_message_content

InlineQueryResultCachedAudio.desc: Represents a link to an MP3 audio file stored on the Telegram servers. By default, this audio file will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the audio.

fields.description: Type of the result, must be audio
fields.name: type

fields.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes
fields.name: id

fields.description: A valid file identifier for the audio file
fields.name: audio_file_id

fields.description: Optional. Caption, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing
fields.name: caption

fields.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the audio caption. See formatting options for more details.
fields.name: parse_mode

fields.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode
fields.name: caption_entities

fields.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message
fields.name: reply_markup

fields.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the audio
fields.name: input_message_content

InlineQueryResultCachedDocument.desc: Represents a link to a file stored on the Telegram servers. By default, this file will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the file.

fields.description: Type of the result, must be document
fields.name: type

fields.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes
fields.name: id

fields.description: Title for the result
fields.name: title

fields.description: A valid file identifier for the file
fields.name: document_file_id

fields.description: Optional. Short description of the result
fields.name: description

fields.description: Optional. Caption of the document to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing
fields.name: caption

fields.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the document caption. See formatting options for more details.
fields.name: parse_mode

fields.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode
fields.name: caption_entities

fields.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message
fields.name: reply_markup

fields.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the file
fields.name: input_message_content

InlineQueryResultCachedGif.desc: Represents a link to an animated GIF file stored on the Telegram servers. By default, this animated GIF file will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with specified content instead of the animation.

fields.description: Type of the result, must be gif
fields.name: type

fields.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes
fields.name: id

fields.description: A valid file identifier for the GIF file
fields.name: gif_file_id

fields.description: Optional. Title for the result
fields.name: title

fields.description: Optional. Caption of the GIF file to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing
fields.name: caption

fields.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the caption. See formatting options for more details.
fields.name: parse_mode

fields.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode
fields.name: caption_entities

fields.description: Optional. Pass True, if the caption must be shown above the message media
fields.name: show_caption_above_media

fields.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message
fields.name: reply_markup

fields.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the GIF animation
fields.name: input_message_content

InlineQueryResultCachedMpeg4Gif.desc: Represents a link to a video animation (H.264/MPEG-4 AVC video without sound) stored on the Telegram servers. By default, this animated MPEG-4 file will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the animation.

fields.description: Type of the result, must be mpeg4_gif
fields.name: type

fields.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes
fields.name: id

fields.description: A valid file identifier for the MPEG4 file
fields.name: mpeg4_file_id

fields.description: Optional. Title for the result
fields.name: title

fields.description: Optional. Caption of the MPEG-4 file to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing
fields.name: caption

fields.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the caption. See formatting options for more details.
fields.name: parse_mode

fields.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode
fields.name: caption_entities

fields.description: Optional. Pass True, if the caption must be shown above the message media
fields.name: show_caption_above_media

fields.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message
fields.name: reply_markup

fields.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the video animation
fields.name: input_message_content

InlineQueryResultCachedPhoto.desc: Represents a link to a photo stored on the Telegram servers. By default, this photo will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the photo.

fields.description: Type of the result, must be photo
fields.name: type

fields.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes
fields.name: id

fields.description: A valid file identifier of the photo
fields.name: photo_file_id

fields.description: Optional. Title for the result
fields.name: title

fields.description: Optional. Short description of the result
fields.name: description

fields.description: Optional. Caption of the photo to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing
fields.name: caption

fields.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the photo caption. See formatting options for more details.
fields.name: parse_mode

fields.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode
fields.name: caption_entities

fields.description: Optional. Pass True, if the caption must be shown above the message media
fields.name: show_caption_above_media

fields.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message
fields.name: reply_markup

fields.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the photo
fields.name: input_message_content

InlineQueryResultCachedSticker.desc: Represents a link to a sticker stored on the Telegram servers. By default, this sticker will be sent by the user. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the sticker.

fields.description: Type of the result, must be sticker
fields.name: type

fields.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes
fields.name: id

fields.description: A valid file identifier of the sticker
fields.name: sticker_file_id

fields.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message
fields.name: reply_markup

fields.description: Optional. Content of the message to be sent instead of the sticker
fields.name: input_message_content

InlineQueryResultCachedVideo.desc: Represents a link to a video file stored on the Telegram servers. By default, this video file will be sent by the user with an optional caption. Alternatively, you can use input_message_content to send a message with the specified content instead of the video.

fields.description: Type of the result, must be video
fields.name: type

fields.description: Unique identifier for this result, 1-64 bytes
fields.name: id

fields.description: A valid file identifier for the video file
fields.name: video_file_id

fields.description: Title for the result
fields.name: title

fields.description: Optional. Short description of the result
fields.name: description

fields.description: Optional. Caption of the video to be sent, 0-1024 characters after entities parsing
fields.name: caption

fields.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the video caption. See formatting options for more details.
fields.name: parse_mode

fields.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode
fields.name: caption_entities

fields.description: Optional. Pass True, if the caption must be shown above the message media
fields.name: show_caption_above_media

InlineQueryResultsButton.desc: This object represents a button to be shown above inline query results. You must use exactly one of the optional fields.

fields.description: Label text on the button
fields.name: text

fields.description: Optional. Description of the Web App that will be launched when the user presses the button. The Web App will be able to switch back to the inline mode using the method switchInlineQuery inside the Web App.
fields.name: web_app

fields.description: Optional. Deep-linking parameter for the /start message sent to the bot when a user presses the button. 1-64 characters, only A-Z, a-z, 0-9, _ and - are allowed.   Example: An inline bot that sends YouTube videos can ask the user to connect the bot to their YouTube account to adapt search results accordingly. To do this, it displays a 'Connect your YouTube account' button above the results, or even before showing any. The user presses the button, switches to a private chat with the bot and, in doing so, passes a start parameter that instructs the bot to return an OAuth link. Once done, the bot can offer a switch_inline button so that the user can easily return to the chat where they wanted to use the bot's inline capabilities.
fields.name: start_parameter

InputInvoiceMessageContent.desc: Represents the content of an invoice message to be sent as the result of an inline query.

fields.description: Product name, 1-32 characters
fields.name: title

fields.description: Product description, 1-255 characters
fields.name: description

fields.description: Bot-defined invoice payload, 1-128 bytes. This will not be displayed to the user, use for your internal processes.
fields.name: payload

fields.description: Optional. Payment provider token, obtained via @BotFather. Pass an empty string for payments in Telegram Stars.
fields.name: provider_token

fields.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code, see more on currencies. Pass “XTR” for payments in Telegram Stars.
fields.name: currency

fields.description: Price breakdown, a JSON-serialized list of components (e.g. product price, tax, discount, delivery cost, delivery tax, bonus, etc.). Must contain exactly one item for payments in Telegram Stars.
fields.name: prices

fields.description: Optional. The maximum accepted amount for tips in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a maximum tip of US$ 1.45 pass max_tip_amount = 145. See the exp parameter in currencies.json, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies). Defaults to 0. Not supported for payments in Telegram Stars.
fields.name: max_tip_amount

fields.description: Optional. A JSON-serialized array of suggested amounts of tip in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). At most 4 suggested tip amounts can be specified. The suggested tip amounts must be positive, passed in a strictly increased order and must not exceed max_tip_amount.
fields.name: suggested_tip_amounts

fields.description: Optional. A JSON-serialized object for data about the invoice, which will be shared with the payment provider. A detailed description of the required fields should be provided by the payment provider.
fields.name: provider_data

fields.description: Optional. URL of the product photo for the invoice. Can be a photo of the goods or a marketing image for a service.
fields.name: photo_url

fields.description: Optional. Photo size in bytes
fields.name: photo_size

fields.description: Optional. Photo width
fields.name: photo_width

fields.description: Optional. Photo height
fields.name: photo_height

fields.description: Optional. Pass True if you require the user's full name to complete the order. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.
fields.name: need_name

fields.description: Optional. Pass True if you require the user's phone number to complete the order. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.
fields.name: need_phone_number

fields.description: Optional. Pass True if you require the user's email address to complete the order. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.
fields.name: need_email

fields.description: Optional. Pass True if you require the user's shipping address to complete the order. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.
fields.name: need_shipping_address

fields.description: Optional. Pass True if the user's phone number should be sent to the provider. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.
fields.name: send_phone_number_to_provider

fields.description: Optional. Pass True if the user's email address should be sent to the provider. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.
fields.name: send_email_to_provider

fields.description: Optional. Pass True if the final price depends on the shipping method. Ignored for payments in Telegram Stars.
fields.name: is_flexible

More information on Sending Files »

Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. fields.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the video caption. See formatting options for more details.
fields.name: parse_mode

fields.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in the caption, which can be specified instead of parse_mode
fields.name: caption_entities

fields.description: Optional. Pass True, if the caption must be shown above the message media
fields.name: show_caption_above_media

fields.description: Optional. Video width
fields.name: width

fields.description: Optional. Video height
fields.name: height

fields.description: Optional. Video duration in seconds
fields.name: duration

fields.description: Optional. Pass True if the uploaded video is suitable for streaming
fields.name: supports_streaming

fields.description: Optional. Pass True if the video needs to be covered with a spoiler animation
fields.name: has_spoiler

InputMessageContent.desc: This object represents the content of a message to be sent as a result of an inline query. Telegram clients currently support the following 5 types: InputTextMessageContent; InputLocationMessageContent; InputVenueMessageContent; InputContactMessageContent; InputInvoiceMessageContent

fields.name: __alias__
fields.type: InputTextMessageContent or InputLocationMessageContent or InputVenueMessageContent or InputContactMessageContent or InputInvoiceMessageContent

InputPaidMedia.desc: This object describes the paid media to be sent. Currently, it can be one of InputPaidMediaPhoto; InputPaidMediaVideo

InputPaidMediaPhoto.desc: The paid media to send is a photo.

fields.description: Type of the media, must be photo
fields.name: type

fields.description: File to send. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. More information on Sending Files »
fields.name: media

InputPaidMediaVideo.desc: The paid media to send is a video.

fields.description: Type of the media, must be video
fields.name: type

fields.description: File to send. Pass a file_id to send a file that exists on the Telegram servers (recommended), pass an HTTP URL for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, or pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. More information on Sending Files »
fields.name: media

fields.description: Optional. Thumbnail of the file sent; can be ignored if thumbnail generation for the file is supported server-side. The thumbnail should be in JPEG format and less than 200 kB in size. A thumbnail's width and height should not exceed 320. Ignored if the file is not uploaded using multipart/form-data. Thumbnails can't be reused and can be only uploaded as a new file, so you can pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” if the thumbnail was uploaded using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name>. More information on Sending Files »
fields.name: thumbnail

fields.description: Optional. Video width
fields.name: width

fields.description: Optional. Video height
fields.name: height

fields.description: Optional. Video duration in seconds
fields.name: duration

fields.description: Optional. Pass True if the uploaded video is suitable for streaming
fields.name: supports_streaming

InputPollOption.desc: This object contains information about one answer option in a poll to be sent.

fields.description: Option text, 1-100 characters
fields.name: text

fields.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the text. See formatting options for more details. Currently, only custom emoji entities are allowed
fields.name: text_parse_mode

fields.description: Optional. A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the poll option text. It can be specified instead of text_parse_mode
fields.name: text_entities

InputSticker.desc: This object describes a sticker to be added to a sticker set.

fields.description: The added sticker. Pass a file_id as a String to send a file that already exists on the Telegram servers, pass an HTTP URL as a String for Telegram to get a file from the Internet, upload a new one using multipart/form-data, or pass “attach://<file_attach_name>” to upload a new one using multipart/form-data under <file_attach_name> name. Animated and video stickers can't be uploaded via HTTP URL. More information on Sending Files »
fields.name: sticker

fields.description: Format of the added sticker, must be one of “static” for a .WEBP or .PNG image, “animated” for a .TGS animation, “video” for a WEBM video
fields.name: format

fields.description: List of 1-20 emoji associated with the sticker
fields.name: emoji_list

fields.description: Optional. Position where the mask should be placed on faces. For “mask” stickers only.
fields.name: mask_position

fields.description: Optional. List of 0-20 search keywords for the sticker with total length of up to 64 characters. For “regular” and “custom_emoji” stickers only.
fields.name: keywords

InputTextMessageContent.desc: Represents the content of a text message to be sent as the result of an inline query.

fields.description: Text of the message to be sent, 1-4096 characters
fields.name: message_text

fields.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the message text. See formatting options for more details.
fields.name: parse_mode

fields.description: Optional. List of special entities that appear in message text, which can be specified instead of parse_mode
fields.name: entities

fields.description: Optional. Link preview generation options for the message
fields.name: link_preview_options

InputVenueMessageContent.desc: Represents the content of a venue message to be sent as the result of an inline query.

fields.description: Latitude of the venue in degrees
fields.name: latitude

fields.description: Longitude of the venue in degrees
fields.name: longitude

fields.description: Name of the venue
fields.name: title

fields.description: Address of the venue
fields.name: address

fields.description: Optional. Foursquare identifier of the venue, if known
fields.name: foursquare_id

fields.description: Optional. Foursquare type of the venue, if known. (For example, “arts_entertainment/default”, “arts_entertainment/aquarium” or “food/icecream”.)
fields.name: foursquare_type

fields.description: Optional. Google Places identifier of the venue
fields.name: google_place_id

fields.description: Optional. Google Places type of the venue. (See supported types.)
fields.name: google_place_type

Invoice.desc: This object contains basic information about an invoice.

fields.description: Product name
fields.name: title

fields.description: Product description
fields.name: description

fields.description: Unique bot deep-linking parameter that can be used to generate this invoice
fields.name: start_parameter

fields.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code, or “XTR” for payments in Telegram Stars
fields.name: currency

fields.description: Total price in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a price of US$ 1.45 pass amount = 145. See the exp parameter in currencies.json, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies).
fields.name: total_amount

KeyboardButton.desc: This object represents one button of the reply keyboard. At most one of the optional fields must be used to specify type of the button. For simple text buttons, String can be used instead of this object to specify the button text.

fields.description: Text of the button. If none of the optional fields are used, it will be sent as a message when the button is pressed
fields.name: text

fields.description: Optional. If specified, pressing the button will open a list of suitable users. Identifiers of selected users will be sent to the bot in a “users_shared” service message. Available in private chats only.
fields.name: request_users

fields.description: Optional. If specified, pressing the button will open a list of suitable chats. Tapping on a chat will send its identifier to the bot in a “chat_shared” service message. Available in private chats only.
fields.name: request_chat

fields.description: Optional. If True, the user's phone number will be sent as a contact when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only.
fields.name: request_contact

fields.description: Optional. If True, the user's current location will be sent when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only.
fields.name: request_location

fields.description: Optional. If specified, the user will be asked to create a poll and send it to the bot when the button is pressed. Available in private chats only.
fields.name: request_poll

fields.description: Optional. If specified, the described Web App will be launched when the button is pressed. The Web App will be able to send a “web_app_data” service message. Available in private chats only.
fields.name: web_app

KeyboardButtonPollType.desc: This object represents type of a poll, which is allowed to be created and sent when the corresponding button is pressed.

fields.description: Optional. If quiz is passed, the user will be allowed to create only polls in the quiz mode. If regular is passed, only regular polls will be allowed. Otherwise, the user will be allowed to create a poll of any type.
fields.name: type

KeyboardButtonRequestChat.desc: This object defines the criteria used to request a suitable chat. Information about the selected chat will be shared with the bot when the corresponding button is pressed. The bot will be granted requested rights in the chat if appropriate. More about requesting chats ».

fields.description: Signed 32-bit identifier of the request, which will be received back in the ChatShared object. Must be unique within the message
fields.name: request_id

fields.description: Pass True to request a channel chat, pass False to request a group or a supergroup chat.
fields.name: chat_is_channel

fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request a forum supergroup, pass False to request a non-forum chat. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.
fields.name: chat_is_forum

fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request a supergroup or a channel with a username, pass False to request a chat without a username. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.
fields.name: chat_has_username

fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request a chat owned by the user. Otherwise, no additional restrictions are applied.
fields.name: chat_is_created

fields.description: Optional. A JSON-serialized object listing the required administrator rights of the user in the chat. The rights must be a superset of bot_administrator_rights. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.
fields.name: user_administrator_rights

fields.description: Optional. A JSON-serialized object listing the required administrator rights of the bot in the chat. The rights must be a subset of user_administrator_rights. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.
fields.name: bot_administrator_rights

fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request a chat with the bot as a member. Otherwise, no additional restrictions are applied.
fields.name: bot_is_member

fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request the chat's title
fields.name: request_title

fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request the chat's username
fields.name: request_username

fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request the chat's photo
fields.name: request_photo

KeyboardButtonRequestUsers.desc: This object defines the criteria used to request suitable users. Information about the selected users will be shared with the bot when the corresponding button is pressed. More about requesting users »

fields.description: Signed 32-bit identifier of the request that will be received back in the UsersShared object. Must be unique within the message
fields.name: request_id

fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request bots, pass False to request regular users. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.
fields.name: user_is_bot

fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request premium users, pass False to request non-premium users. If not specified, no additional restrictions are applied.
fields.name: user_is_premium

fields.description: Optional. The maximum number of users to be selected; 1-10. Defaults to 1.
fields.name: max_quantity

fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request the users' first and last names
fields.name: request_name

fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request the users' usernames
fields.name: request_username

fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request the users' photos
fields.name: request_photo

LabeledPrice.desc: This object represents a portion of the price for goods or services.

fields.description: Portion label
fields.name: label

fields.description: Price of the product in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a price of US$ 1.45 pass amount = 145. See the exp parameter in currencies.json, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies).
fields.name: amount

LinkPreviewOptions.desc: Describes the options used for link preview generation.

fields.description: Optional. True, if the link preview is disabled
fields.name: is_disabled

fields.description: Optional. URL to use for the link preview. If empty, then the first URL found in the message text will be used
fields.name: url

fields.description: Optional. True, if the media in the link preview is supposed to be shrunk; ignored if the URL isn't explicitly specified or media size change isn't supported for the preview
fields.name: prefer_small_media

fields.description: Optional. True, if the media in the link preview is supposed to be enlarged; ignored if the URL isn't explicitly specified or media size change isn't supported for the preview
fields.name: prefer_large_media

fields.description: Optional. True, if the link preview must be shown above the message text; otherwise, the link preview will be shown below the message text
fields.name: show_above_text

Location.desc: This object represents a point on the map.

fields.description: Latitude as defined by the sender
fields.name: latitude

fields.description: Longitude as defined by the sender
fields.name: longitude

fields.description: Optional. The radius of uncertainty for the location, measured in meters; 0-1500
fields.name: horizontal_accuracy

fields.description: Optional. Time relative to the message sending date, during which the location can be updated; in seconds. For active live locations only.
fields.name: live_period

fields.description: Optional. The direction in which user is moving, in degrees; 1-360. For active live locations only.
fields.name: heading

fields.description: Optional. The maximum distance for proximity alerts about approaching another chat member, in meters. For sent live locations only.
fields.name: proximity_alert_radius

LoginUrl.desc: This object represents a parameter of the inline keyboard button used to automatically authorize a user. Serves as a great replacement for the Telegram Login Widget when the user is coming from Telegram. All the user needs to do is tap/click a button and confirm that they want to log in: Telegram apps support these buttons as of version 5.7. Sample bot: @discussbot

fields.description: An HTTPS URL to be opened with user authorization data added to the query string when the button is pressed. If the user refuses to provide authorization data, the original URL without information about the user will be opened. The data added is the same as described in Receiving authorization data.   NOTE: You must always check the hash of the received data to verify the authentication and the integrity of the data as described in Checking authorization.
fields.name: url

fields.description: Optional. New text of the button in forwarded messages.
fields.name: forward_text

fields.description: Optional. Username of a bot, which will be used for user authorization. See Setting up a bot for more details. If not specified, the current bot's username will be assumed. The url's domain must be the same as the domain linked with the bot. See Linking your domain to the bot for more details.
fields.name: bot_username

fields.description: Optional. Pass True to request the permission for your bot to send messages to the user.
fields.name: request_write_access

MaskPosition.desc: This object describes the position on faces where a mask should be placed by default.

fields.description: The part of the face relative to which the mask should be placed. One of “forehead”, “eyes”, “mouth”, or “chin”.
fields.name: point

fields.description: Shift by X-axis measured in widths of the mask scaled to the face size, from left to right. For example, choosing -1.0 will place mask just to the left of the default mask position.
fields.name: x_shift

fields.description: Shift by Y-axis measured in heights of the mask scaled to the face size, from top to bottom. For example, 1.0 will place the mask just below the default mask position.
fields.name: y_shift

fields.description: Mask scaling coefficient. For example, 2.0 means double size.
fields.name: scale

MaybeInaccessibleMessage.desc: This object describes a message that can be inaccessible to the bot. It can be one of Message; InaccessibleMessage

MenuButton.desc: This object describes the bot's menu button in a private chat. It should be one of MenuButtonCommands; MenuButtonWebApp; MenuButtonDefault

MenuButtonCommands.desc: Represents a menu button, which opens the bot's list of commands.

fields.description: Type of the button, must be commands
fields.name: type

MenuButtonDefault.desc: Describes that no specific value for the menu button was set.

fields.description: Type of the button, must be default
fields.name: type

MenuButtonWebApp.desc: Represents a menu button, which launches a Web App.

fields.description: Type of the button, must be web_app
fields.name: type

fields.description: Text on the button
fields.name: text

fields.description: Description of the Web App that will be launched when the user presses the button. The Web App will be able to send an arbitrary message on behalf of the user using the method answerWebAppQuery. Alternatively, a t.me link to a Web App of the bot can be specified in the object instead of the Web App's URL, in which case the Web App will be opened as if the user pressed the link.
fields.name: web_app

fields.description: Unique message identifier inside this chat
fields.name: message_id

fields.description: Optional. Unique identifier of a message thread to which the message belongs; for supergroups only
fields.name: message_thread_id

fields.description: Optional. Sender of the message; empty for messages sent to channels. For backward compatibility, the field contains a fake sender user in non-channel chats, if the message was sent on behalf of a chat.
fields.name: from

fields.description: Optional. Sender of the message, sent on behalf of a chat. For example, the channel itself for channel posts, the supergroup itself for messages from anonymous group administrators, the linked channel for messages automatically forwarded to the discussion group. For backward compatibility, the field from contains a fake sender user in non-channel chats, if the message was sent on behalf of a chat.
fields.name: sender_chat

fields.description: Optional. If the sender of the message boosted the chat, the number of boosts added by the user
fields.name: sender_boost_count

fields.description: Optional. The bot that actually sent the message on behalf of the business account. Available only for outgoing messages sent on behalf of the connected business account.
fields.name: sender_business_bot

fields.description: Date the message was sent in Unix time. It is always a positive number, representing a valid date.
fields.name: date

fields.description: Optional. Unique identifier of the business connection from which the message was received. If non-empty, the message belongs to a chat of the corresponding business account that is independent from any potential bot chat which might share the same identifier.
fields.name: business_connection_id

fields.description: Chat the message belongs to
fields.name: chat

fields.description: Optional. Information about the original message for forwarded messages
fields.name: forward_origin

fields.description: Optional. True, if the message is sent to a forum topic
fields.name: is_topic_message

fields.description: Optional. True, if the message is a channel post that was automatically forwarded to the connected discussion group
fields.name: is_automatic_forward

fields.description: Optional. For replies in the same chat and message thread, the original message. Note that the Message object in this field will not contain further reply_to_message fields even if it itself is a reply.
fields.name: reply_to_message

fields.description: Optional. Information about the message that is being replied to, which may come from another chat or forum topic
fields.name: external_reply

fields.description: Optional. For replies that quote part of the original message, the quoted part of the message
fields.name: quote

fields.description: Optional. For replies to a story, the original story
fields.name: reply_to_story

fields.description: Optional. Bot through which the message was sent
fields.name: via_bot

fields.description: Optional. Date the message was last edited in Unix time
fields.name: edit_date

fields.description: Optional. True, if the message can't be forwarded
fields.name: has_protected_content

fields.description: Optional. True, if the message was sent by an implicit action, for example, as an away or a greeting business message, or as a scheduled message
fields.name: is_from_offline

fields.description: Optional. The unique identifier of a media message group this message belongs to
fields.name: media_group_id

fields.description: Optional. Signature of the post author for messages in channels, or the custom title of an anonymous group administrator
fields.name: author_signature

fields.description: Optional. For text messages, the actual UTF-8 text of the message
fields.name: text

fields.description: Optional. For text messages, special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the text
fields.name: entities

fields.description: Optional. Options used for link preview generation for the message, if it is a text message and link preview options were changed
fields.name: link_preview_options

fields.description: Optional. Unique identifier of the message effect added to the message
fields.name: effect_id

fields.description: Optional. Message is an animation, information about the animation. For backward compatibility, when this field is set, the document field will also be set
fields.name: animation

fields.description: Optional. Message is an audio file, information about the file
fields.name: audio

fields.description: Optional. Message is a general file, information about the file
fields.name: document

fields.description: Optional. Message contains paid media; information about the paid media
fields.name: paid_media

fields.description: Optional. Message is a photo, available sizes of the photo
fields.name: photo

fields.description: Optional. Message is a sticker, information about the sticker
fields.name: sticker

fields.description: Optional. Message is a forwarded story
fields.name: story

fields.description: Optional. Message is a video, information about the video
fields.name: video

fields.description: Optional. Message is a video note, information about the video message
fields.name: video_note

fields.description: Optional. Message is a voice message, information about the file
fields.name: voice

fields.description: Optional. Caption for the animation, audio, document, paid media, photo, video or voice
fields.name: caption

fields.description: Optional. For messages with a caption, special entities like usernames, URLs, bot commands, etc. that appear in the caption
fields.name: caption_entities

fields.description: Optional. True, if the caption must be shown above the message media
fields.name: show_caption_above_media

fields.description: Optional. True, if the message media is covered by a spoiler animation
fields.name: has_media_spoiler

fields.description: Optional. Message is a shared contact, information about the contact
fields.name: contact

fields.description: Optional. Message is a dice with random value
fields.name: dice

fields.description: Optional. Message is a game, information about the game. More about games »
fields.name: game

fields.description: Optional. Message is a native poll, information about the poll
fields.name: poll

fields.description: Optional. Message is a venue, information about the venue. For backward compatibility, when this field is set, the location field will also be set
fields.name: venue

fields.description: Optional. Message is a shared location, information about the location
fields.name: location

fields.description: Optional. New members that were added to the group or supergroup and information about them (the bot itself may be one of these members)
fields.name: new_chat_members

fields.description: Optional. A member was removed from the group, information about them (this member may be the bot itself)
fields.name: left_chat_member

fields.description: Optional. A chat title was changed to this value
fields.name: new_chat_title

fields.description: Optional. A chat photo was change to this value
fields.name: new_chat_photo

fields.description: Optional. Service message: the chat photo was deleted
fields.name: delete_chat_photo

fields.description: Optional. Service message: the group has been created
fields.name: group_chat_created

fields.description: Optional. Service message: the supergroup has been created. This field can't be received in a message coming through updates, because bot can't be a member of a supergroup when it is created. It can only be found in reply_to_message if someone replies to a very first message in a directly created supergroup.
fields.name: supergroup_chat_created

fields.description: Optional. Service message: the channel has been created. This field can't be received in a message coming through updates, because bot can't be a member of a channel when it is created. It can only be found in reply_to_message if someone replies to a very first message in a channel.
fields.name: channel_chat_created

fields.description: Optional. Service message: auto-delete timer settings changed in the chat
fields.name: message_auto_delete_timer_changed

fields.description: Optional. The group has been migrated to a supergroup with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.
fields.name: migrate_to_chat_id

fields.description: Optional. The supergroup has been migrated from a group with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.
fields.name: migrate_from_chat_id

fields.description: Optional. Specified message was pinned. Note that the Message object in this field will not contain further reply_to_message fields even if it itself is a reply.
fields.name: pinned_message

fields.description: Optional. Message is an invoice for a payment, information about the invoice. More about payments »
fields.name: invoice

fields.description: Optional. Message is a service message about a successful payment, information about the payment. More about payments »
fields.name: successful_payment

fields.description: Optional. Message is a service message about a refunded payment, information about the payment. More about payments »
fields.name: refunded_payment

fields.description: Optional. Service message: users were shared with the bot
fields.name: users_shared

fields.description: Optional. Service message: a chat was shared with the bot
fields.name: chat_shared

fields.description: Optional. The domain name of the website on which the user has logged in. More about Telegram Login »
fields.name: connected_website

fields.description: Optional. Service message: the user allowed the bot to write messages after adding it to the attachment or side menu, launching a Web App from a link, or accepting an explicit request from a Web App sent by the method requestWriteAccess
fields.name: write_access_allowed

fields.description: Optional. Telegram Passport data
fields.name: passport_data

fields.description: Optional. Service message. A user in the chat triggered another user's proximity alert while sharing Live Location.
fields.name: proximity_alert_triggered

fields.description: Optional. Service message: user boosted the chat
fields.name: boost_added

fields.description: Optional. Service message: chat background set
fields.name: chat_background_set

fields.description: Optional. Service message: forum topic created
fields.name: forum_topic_created

fields.description: Optional. Service message: forum topic edited
fields.name: forum_topic_edited

fields.description: Optional. Service message: forum topic closed
fields.name: forum_topic_closed

fields.description: Optional. Service message: forum topic reopened
fields.name: forum_topic_reopened

fields.description: Optional. Service message: the 'General' forum topic hidden
fields.name: general_forum_topic_hidden

fields.description: Optional. Service message: the 'General' forum topic unhidden
fields.name: general_forum_topic_unhidden

fields.description: Optional. Service message: a scheduled giveaway was created
fields.name: giveaway_created

fields.description: Optional. The message is a scheduled giveaway message
fields.name: giveaway

fields.description: Optional. A giveaway with public winners was completed
fields.name: giveaway_winners

fields.description: Optional. Service message: a giveaway without public winners was completed
fields.name: giveaway_completed

fields.description: Optional. Service message: video chat scheduled
fields.name: video_chat_scheduled

fields.description: Optional. Service message: video chat started
fields.name: video_chat_started

fields.description: Optional. Service message: video chat ended
fields.name: video_chat_ended

fields.description: Optional. Service message: new participants invited to a video chat
fields.name: video_chat_participants_invited

fields.description: Optional. Service message: data sent by a Web App
fields.name: web_app_data

fields.description: Optional. Inline keyboard attached to the message. login_url buttons are represented as ordinary url buttons.
fields.name: reply_markup

MessageAutoDeleteTimerChanged.desc: This object represents a service message about a change in auto-delete timer settings.

fields.description: New auto-delete time for messages in the chat; in seconds
fields.name: message_auto_delete_time

MessageEntity.desc: This object represents one special entity in a text message. For example, hashtags, usernames, URLs, etc.

fields.description: Type of the entity. Currently, can be “mention” (@username), “hashtag” (#hashtag), “cashtag” ($USD), “bot_command” (/start@jobs_bot), “url” (https://telegram.org), “email” (do-not-reply@telegram.org), “phone_number” (+1-212-555-0123), “bold” (bold text), “italic” (italic text), “underline” (underlined text), “strikethrough” (strikethrough text), “spoiler” (spoiler message), “blockquote” (block quotation), “expandable_blockquote” (collapsed-by-default block quotation), “code” (monowidth string), “pre” (monowidth block), “text_link” (for clickable text URLs), “text_mention” (for users without usernames), “custom_emoji” (for inline custom emoji stickers)
fields.name: type

fields.description: Offset in UTF-16 code units to the start of the entity
fields.name: offset

fields.description: Length of the entity in UTF-16 code units
fields.name: length

fields.description: Optional. For “text_link” only, URL that will be opened after user taps on the text
fields.name: url

fields.description: Optional. For “text_mention” only, the mentioned user
fields.name: user

fields.description: Optional. For “pre” only, the programming language of the entity text
fields.name: language

ReplyKeyboardMarkup.desc: This object represents a custom keyboard with reply options (see Introduction to bots for details and examples). Not supported in channels and for messages sent on behalf of a Telegram Business account.

fields.description: Array of button rows, each represented by an Array of KeyboardButton objects
fields.name: keyboard

fields.description: Optional. Requests clients to always show the keyboard when the regular keyboard is hidden. Defaults to false, in which case the custom keyboard can be hidden and opened with a keyboard icon.
fields.name: is_persistent

fields.description: Optional. Requests clients to resize the keyboard vertically for optimal fit (e.g., make the keyboard smaller if there are just two rows of buttons). Defaults to false, in which case the custom keyboard is always of the same height as the app's standard keyboard.
fields.name: resize_keyboard

fields.description: Optional. Requests clients to hide the keyboard as soon as it's been used. The keyboard will still be available, but clients will automatically display the usual letter-keyboard in the chat - the user can press a special button in the input field to see the custom keyboard again. Defaults to false.
fields.name: one_time_keyboard

fields.description: Optional. The placeholder to be shown in the input field when the keyboard is active; 1-64 characters
fields.name: input_field_placeholder

fields.description: Optional. Use this parameter if you want to show the keyboard to specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply to a message in the same chat and forum topic, sender of the original message.   Example: A user requests to change the bot's language, bot replies to the request with a keyboard to select the new language. Other users in the group don't see the keyboard.
fields.name: selective

ReplyKeyboardRemove.desc: Upon receiving a message with this object, Telegram clients will remove the current custom keyboard and display the default letter-keyboard. By default, custom keyboards are displayed until a new keyboard is sent by a bot. An exception is made for one-time keyboards that are hidden immediately after the user presses a button (see ReplyKeyboardMarkup). Not supported in channels and for messages sent on behalf of a Telegram Business account.

fields.description: Requests clients to remove the custom keyboard (user will not be able to summon this keyboard; if you want to hide the keyboard from sight but keep it accessible, use one_time_keyboard in ReplyKeyboardMarkup)
fields.name: remove_keyboard

fields.description: Optional. Use this parameter if you want to remove the keyboard for specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply to a message in the same chat and forum topic, sender of the original message.   Example: A user votes in a poll, bot returns confirmation message in reply to the vote and removes the keyboard for that user, while still showing the keyboard with poll options to users who haven't voted yet.
fields.name: selective

ReplyParameters.desc: Describes reply parameters for the message that is being sent.

fields.description: Identifier of the message that will be replied to in the current chat, or in the chat chat_id if it is specified
fields.name: message_id

fields.description: Optional. If the message to be replied to is from a different chat, unique identifier for the chat or username of the channel (in the format @channelusername). Not supported for messages sent on behalf of a business account.
fields.name: chat_id

fields.description: Optional. Pass True if the message should be sent even if the specified message to be replied to is not found. Always False for replies in another chat or forum topic. Always True for messages sent on behalf of a business account.
fields.name: allow_sending_without_reply

fields.description: Optional. Quoted part of the message to be replied to; 0-1024 characters after entities parsing. The quote must be an exact substring of the message to be replied to, including bold, italic, underline, strikethrough, spoiler, and custom_emoji entities. The message will fail to send if the quote isn't found in the original message.
fields.name: quote

fields.description: Optional. Mode for parsing entities in the quote. See formatting options for more details.
fields.name: quote_parse_mode

fields.description: Optional. A JSON-serialized list of special entities that appear in the quote. It can be specified instead of quote_parse_mode.
fields.name: quote_entities

fields.description: Optional. Position of the quote in the original message in UTF-16 code units
fields.name: quote_position

ResponseParameters.desc: Describes why a request was unsuccessful.

fields.description: Optional. The group has been migrated to a supergroup with the specified identifier. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.
