TextQuote.desc: This object contains information about the quoted part of a message that is replied to by the given message.

fields.description: Text of the quoted part of a message that is replied to by the given message
fields.name: text

fields.description: Optional. Special entities that appear in the quote. Currently, only bold, italic, underline, strikethrough, spoiler, and custom_emoji entities are kept in quotes.
fields.name: entities

fields.description: Approximate quote position in the original message in UTF-16 code units as specified by the sender
fields.name: position

fields.description: Optional. True, if the quote was chosen manually by the message sender. Otherwise, the quote was added automatically by the server.
fields.name: is_manual

TransactionPartner.desc: This object describes the source of a transaction, or its recipient for outgoing transactions. Currently, it can be one of TransactionPartnerUser; TransactionPartnerFragment; TransactionPartnerTelegramAds; TransactionPartnerOther

fields.name: __alias__
fields.type: TransactionPartnerUser or TransactionPartnerFragment or TransactionPartnerTelegramAds or TransactionPartnerOther

TransactionPartnerFragment.desc: Describes a withdrawal transaction with Fragment.

fields.description: Type of the transaction partner, always “fragment”
fields.name: type

fields.description: Optional. State of the transaction if the transaction is outgoing
fields.name: withdrawal_state

TransactionPartnerOther.desc: Describes a transaction with an unknown source or recipient.

fields.description: Type of the transaction partner, always “other”
fields.name: type

TransactionPartnerTelegramAds.desc: Describes a withdrawal transaction to the Telegram Ads platform.

fields.description: Type of the transaction partner, always “telegram_ads”
fields.name: type

TransactionPartnerUser.desc: Describes a transaction with a user.

fields.description: Type of the transaction partner, always “user”
fields.name: type

fields.description: Information about the user
fields.name: user

fields.description: Optional. Bot-specified invoice payload
fields.name: invoice_payload

Update.desc: This object represents an incoming update. At most one of the optional parameters can be present in any given update.

fields.description: The update's unique identifier. Update identifiers start from a certain positive number and increase sequentially. This identifier becomes especially handy if you're using webhooks, since it allows you to ignore repeated updates or to restore the correct update sequence, should they get out of order. If there are no new updates for at least a week, then identifier of the next update will be chosen randomly instead of sequentially.
fields.name: update_id

fields.description: Optional. New incoming message of any kind - text, photo, sticker, etc.
fields.name: message

fields.description: Optional. New version of a message that is known to the bot and was edited. This update may at times be triggered by changes to message fields that are either unavailable or not actively used by your bot.
fields.name: edited_message

fields.description: Optional. New incoming channel post of any kind - text, photo, sticker, etc.
fields.name: channel_post

fields.description: Optional. New version of a channel post that is known to the bot and was edited. This update may at times be triggered by changes to message fields that are either unavailable or not actively used by your bot.
fields.name: edited_channel_post

fields.description: Optional. The bot was connected to or disconnected from a business account, or a user edited an existing connection with the bot
fields.name: business_connection

fields.description: Optional. New message from a connected business account
fields.name: business_message

fields.description: Optional. New version of a message from a connected business account
fields.name: edited_business_message

fields.description: Optional. Messages were deleted from a connected business account
fields.name: deleted_business_messages

fields.description: Optional. A reaction to a message was changed by a user. The bot must be an administrator in the chat and must explicitly specify "message_reaction" in the list of allowed_updates to receive these updates. The update isn't received for reactions set by bots.
fields.name: message_reaction

fields.description: Optional. Reactions to a message with anonymous reactions were changed. The bot must be an administrator in the chat and must explicitly specify "message_reaction_count" in the list of allowed_updates to receive these updates. The updates are grouped and can be sent with delay up to a few minutes.
fields.name: message_reaction_count

fields.description: Optional. New incoming inline query
fields.name: inline_query

fields.description: Optional. The result of an inline query that was chosen by a user and sent to their chat partner. Please see our documentation on the feedback collecting for details on how to enable these updates for your bot.
fields.name: chosen_inline_result

fields.description: Optional. New incoming callback query
fields.name: callback_query

fields.description: Optional. New incoming shipping query. Only for invoices with flexible price
fields.name: shipping_query

fields.description: Optional. New incoming pre-checkout query. Contains full information about checkout
fields.name: pre_checkout_query

fields.description: Optional. New poll state. Bots receive only updates about manually stopped polls and polls, which are sent by the bot
fields.name: poll

fields.description: Optional. A user changed their answer in a non-anonymous poll. Bots receive new votes only in polls that were sent by the bot itself.
fields.name: poll_answer

fields.description: Optional. The bot's chat member status was updated in a chat. For private chats, this update is received only when the bot is blocked or unblocked by the user.
fields.name: my_chat_member

fields.description: Optional. A chat member's status was updated in a chat. The bot must be an administrator in the chat and must explicitly specify "chat_member" in the list of allowed_updates to receive these updates.
fields.name: chat_member

fields.description: Optional. A request to join the chat has been sent. The bot must have the can_invite_users administrator right in the chat to receive these updates.
fields.name: chat_join_request

fields.description: Optional. A chat boost was added or changed. The bot must be an administrator in the chat to receive these updates.
fields.name: chat_boost

fields.description: Optional. A boost was removed from a chat. The bot must be an administrator in the chat to receive these updates.
fields.name: removed_chat_boost

User.desc: This object represents a Telegram user or bot.

fields.description: Unique identifier for this user or bot. This number may have more than 32 significant bits and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this identifier.
fields.name: id

fields.description: True, if this user is a bot
fields.name: is_bot

fields.description: User's or bot's first name
fields.name: first_name

fields.description: Optional. User's or bot's last name
fields.name: last_name

fields.description: Optional. User's or bot's username
fields.name: username

fields.description: Optional. IETF language tag of the user's language
fields.name: language_code

fields.description: Optional. True, if this user is a Telegram Premium user
fields.name: is_premium

fields.description: Optional. True, if this user added the bot to the attachment menu
fields.name: added_to_attachment_menu

fields.description: Optional. True, if the bot can be invited to groups. Returned only in getMe.
fields.name: can_join_groups

fields.description: Optional. True, if privacy mode is disabled for the bot. Returned only in getMe.
fields.name: can_read_all_group_messages

fields.description: Optional. True, if the bot supports inline queries. Returned only in getMe.
fields.name: supports_inline_queries

fields.description: Optional. True, if the bot can be connected to a Telegram Business account to receive its messages. Returned only in getMe.
fields.name: can_connect_to_business

UserChatBoosts.desc: This object represents a list of boosts added to a chat by a user.

fields.description: The list of boosts added to the chat by the user
fields.name: boosts

UserProfilePhotos.desc: This object represent a user's profile pictures.

fields.description: Total number of profile pictures the target user has
fields.name: total_count

fields.description: Requested profile pictures (in up to 4 sizes each)
fields.name: photos

UsersShared.desc: This object contains information about the users whose identifiers were shared with the bot using a KeyboardButtonRequestUsers button.

fields.description: Identifier of the request
fields.name: request_id

fields.description: Information about users shared with the bot.
fields.name: users

fields.description: Venue location. Can't be a live location
fields.name: location

fields.description: Name of the venue
fields.name: title

fields.description: Address of the venue
fields.name: address

fields.description: Optional. Foursquare identifier of the venue
fields.name: foursquare_id

fields.description: Optional. Foursquare type of the venue. (For example, “arts_entertainment/default”, “arts_entertainment/aquarium” or “food/icecream”.)
fields.name: foursquare_type

fields.description: Optional. Google Places identifier of the venue
fields.name: google_place_id

fields.description: Optional. Google Places type of the venue. (See supported types.)
fields.name: google_place_type

Video.desc: This object represents a video file.

fields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file
fields.name: file_id

fields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.
fields.name: file_unique_id

fields.description: Video width as defined by the sender
fields.name: width

fields.description: Video height as defined by the sender
fields.name: height

fields.description: Duration of the video in seconds as defined by the sender
fields.name: duration

fields.description: Optional. Video thumbnail
fields.name: thumbnail

fields.description: Optional. Original filename as defined by the sender
fields.name: file_name

fields.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by the sender
fields.name: mime_type

fields.description: Optional. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.
fields.name: file_size

VideoChatEnded.desc: This object represents a service message about a video chat ended in the chat.

fields.description: Video chat duration in seconds
fields.name: duration

VideoChatParticipantsInvited.desc: This object represents a service message about new members invited to a video chat.

fields.description: New members that were invited to the video chat
fields.name: users

VideoChatScheduled.desc: This object represents a service message about a video chat scheduled in the chat.

fields.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the video chat is supposed to be started by a chat administrator
fields.name: start_date

VideoChatStarted.desc: This object represents a service message about a video chat started in the chat. Currently holds no information.

VideoNote.desc: This object represents a video message (available in Telegram apps as of v.4.0).

fields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file
fields.name: file_id

fields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.
fields.name: file_unique_id

fields.description: Video width and height (diameter of the video message) as defined by the sender
fields.name: length

fields.description: Duration of the video in seconds as defined by the sender
fields.name: duration

fields.description: Optional. Video thumbnail
fields.name: thumbnail

fields.description: Optional. File size in bytes
fields.name: file_size

Voice.desc: This object represents a voice note.

fields.description: Identifier for this file, which can be used to download or reuse the file
fields.name: file_id

fields.description: Unique identifier for this file, which is supposed to be the same over time and for different bots. Can't be used to download or reuse the file.
fields.name: file_unique_id

fields.description: Duration of the audio in seconds as defined by the sender
fields.name: duration

fields.description: Optional. MIME type of the file as defined by the sender
fields.name: mime_type

fields.description: Optional. File size in bytes. It can be bigger than 2^31 and some programming languages may have difficulty/silent defects in interpreting it. But it has at most 52 significant bits, so a signed 64-bit integer or double-precision float type are safe for storing this value.
fields.name: file_size

WebAppData.desc: Describes data sent from a Web App to the bot.

fields.description: The data. Be aware that a bad client can send arbitrary data in this field.
fields.name: data

fields.description: Text of the web_app keyboard button from which the Web App was opened. Be aware that a bad client can send arbitrary data in this field.
fields.name: button_text

fields.description: An HTTPS URL of a Web App to be opened with additional data as specified in Initializing Web Apps
fields.name: url

WebhookInfo.desc: Describes the current status of a webhook.

fields.description: Webhook URL, may be empty if webhook is not set up
fields.name: url

fields.description: True, if a custom certificate was provided for webhook certificate checks
fields.name: has_custom_certificate

fields.description: Number of updates awaiting delivery
fields.name: pending_update_count

fields.description: Optional. Currently used webhook IP address
fields.name: ip_address

fields.description: Optional. Unix time for the most recent error that happened when trying to deliver an update via webhook
fields.name: last_error_date

fields.description: Optional. Error message in human-readable format for the most recent error that happened when trying to deliver an update via webhook
fields.name: last_error_message

fields.description: Optional. Unix time of the most recent error that happened when trying to synchronize available updates with Telegram datacenters
fields.name: last_synchronization_error_date

fields.description: Optional. The maximum allowed number of simultaneous HTTPS connections to the webhook for update delivery
fields.name: max_connections

fields.description: Optional. A list of update types the bot is subscribed to. Defaults to all update types except chat_member
fields.name: allowed_updates

WriteAccessAllowed.desc: This object represents a service message about a user allowing a bot to write messages after adding it to the attachment menu, launching a Web App from a link, or accepting an explicit request from a Web App sent by the method requestWriteAccess.

fields.description: Optional. True, if the access was granted after the user accepted an explicit request from a Web App sent by the method requestWriteAccess
fields.name: from_request

fields.description: Optional. Name of the Web App, if the access was granted when the Web App was launched from a link
fields.name: web_app_name

fields.description: Optional. True, if the access was granted when the bot was added to the attachment or side menu
fields.name: from_attachment_menu
